Reviews.Title: “Cheap, and very Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: mckee74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year with my lovely fiance. When we stay in Orlando, we basically want a hotel for a base, store our stuff, sleep. We don't look for a place to hang around, and that is why this hotel is perfect. Rooms are basic and the norm - TV, fridge, table & chairs etc - but with a few things you wouldn't expect like free wi-fi (which was surprisingly excellent) and a very good safe. They were kept very clean during our stay, never had a problem with fresh sheets and towels. Facilities are great. Two big pools (didn't really use them but can imagine those with kids would love it), an excellent bar ($5 for a four pint pitcher, thank you very much), a handy shop etc. Never ate at the resturant but it looked fine to me. A few folks have mentioned it's no where near anywhere. Couldn't disagree more. Could maybe be an issue if you haven't got a car (although free shuttles are offered), but if you have a car you'll have no issue. About 10-20 minute drive to all the major parks. Near by there is a Target, a Publix (a very cheap and huge supermarket) and several places to eat for varying budgets. A few folks also seem to be very picky considering how much you are paying. This place is very cheap, and is worth every penny. Will be returning next year. Hope the beer is still five bucks...

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: E H
Reviews.Content: The "Hotel" is actually like something straight out of My Name is Earl. Filthy carpets, bugs in the refridgerator and all over the room. Horrendously misrepresented by the pictures on the website, the bbq area and lagoon are disgraceful. I paid for 2 star Quality, but would never stay here, recommend it, etc. In fairness the staff are very friendly and all issues raised were dealt with, they seem to know with the quality of their resort, they HAVE to provide good service. Bar is very reasonable, with Long Island Iced tea recommended. My honest advice, not even worth the small amount paid, I will never stay here again, you have been warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat this hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kimberley04
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have stayed here on one of our trips to Florida, and plan to stay here again (and all subsequent visits to be honest!) We paid around $20 a night, and for that got a clean and well maintained room with all the basic amenities you would expect. Better than average places though was the bar with drinks offers. It was nice to see that many locals in the area frequent the bar on a weekend too! We enjoyed our trip, and Champions World Resort can't be beaten for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Customer care? The never heard of it!”
Reviews.Author: Raising3Kids
Reviews.Content: My daughter got hurt climbing out of their pool. Her foot was gashed on the new step on their ladder.. We missed our 2 days at Disney water parks , the hotel had no first aid supplies, I had to rent a wheelchair for my daughter for 3 days and push her all around Disney... And they didn't do a thing. I've been waiting for their insurance company to contact me ( that's what they tell me each to e I've called) for 3 weeks. Never mind that I hurt my back with the wheelchair, or that my daughter is scarred.. They haven't even repaid the $36 for the stupid wheelchair! all I wanted was a bill adjustment.. I was informed they don't do anything like that, even for the 36 .. It's all throu the insurance but they have yet to tell me who that is either!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Champions!”
Reviews.Author: Skmoore4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Champions for second straight year (Apr 5-10, 2012), and was very pleased once again! They had made improvements by replacing old carpeting with nice tile and received same great service, clean rooms, well maintained grounds and pools, and free wifi as last year. There newly opened nature area is also a great benefit (if you have time and energy to get over there and explore) that you will never find at other budget motels. Only problem I had on first night was a slow shower drain, but after a call to report at front desk, and upon return from Disney park the following day, shower was completely fixed. Maintenance staff great there. Have read other reviews that call Champions and the surrounding area "trashy" but this is completely inaccurate. Its actually in one of the best sections of Kissimmee to stay in and very close to Disney parks (its surrounded by other resort communities and golf courses). Trust me, you will not beat the value you get here for such a low price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: carltonmike
Reviews.Content: Well positioned for Disney ....good value basic accommodation. Very welcoming friendly bar.

Reviews.Title: “Trashy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: margozinha1
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, outdated amenities, and the mean night desk lady. Gobs of hair in the bathroom... Located in a trashy Kissimmee neighborhood where the best surrounding restaurants are chains. Appears to have been an old Comfort Inn or Howard Johnson now frequented by international travelers who book packages but don't know what they are getting into.... I would not stay there again or recommend it to anyone who wants to have a semi-comfortable vacation, even the budget traveler. The only thing going for this place is the nice bartender who makes semi-decent Margaritas...and quick 15 minute drive to Disney attractions, otherwise, YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “March Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: WJBeam
Reviews.Content: I brought my family to Florida for March Break 2012..the five yr old Granddaughter was going to see her Princess's and other Disney Characters. We reserved our PoolSide Room on-line and got confirmed and three days later also got room verification by telephone. We have stayed at Champions Resort in the past and when in the Kissimmee area of Florida, we wouldn't stay anywhere else but Champions Resort. Upon arrival we were greeted with a smile by the desk clerk who had just finished with a lineup of people checking in and she handled everything very well. Our room was as would be expected and advertised clean and orderly. We enjoyed the use of the three swimming pools and the hot tub. We enjoyed quiet evenings taking walks around the Champion property and its plain to see they are constantly trying to upgrade and make their facility traveler and vacationer friendly. Their was no loud music nor rowdy goings on and sleep came easy every night! The room/bathroom was cleaned and beds made daily and the folks what did the rooms always had a smile and were very friendly. The gentleman that took care of securing the pools every evening a big hats off to you sir I do not remember your name sadly but allowing us to enjoy the hot tub a short time longer after hours was very kind of you it sure helped after a day of beating the streets sightseeing:) To the two ladies on the desk midweek THANK YOU for taking the time to print us out the Tidal Charts for Coco Beach, it was a wonderfdul day and the granddaughter found some awesome shells during low tide and she wants to come back to look for the sea glass you told her about! The whole six days we stayed at Champions resort we had no complaints or any reason for complaints...The Owners and the Department Heads should be quite proud of their Staff and their Resort....we have told all our friends and family that if they are planning a trip to Kissimmee that they should stay at Champions Resort. We will be planning another family vacation as the family enjoys the Kissimmee Area and we wouldn't dream of not including Champions Resort into our vacation plans! We arrived 3/10/2012 departed 3/16/2012 THANK YOU CHAPIONS RESORT from the BEAM FAMILY!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - I REPEAT DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so misrepresented by the pictures online. Folks, the place is filfthy and to top it off the rooms SMELL. We had to spray perfume on our wrists so that we could overcome the NASTY Smell coming from either the AC unit or the filfthy carpeting. Now lets go the the misrepresented fitness center. It is the dirtiest room you can imagine with FILFTHY equipment and old equipment - it is NOT anything like the pictures. The shuttle ONLY RUNS TWICE A DAY TO EITHER EPCOT OR THE MAGIC KINGDOM and wait to you hear this. It takes over an hour from the time they pick you up to go 3 miles to the park as it STOPS at 7 more hotels on the road. Then if you want to come back you need to get a bus at either 8:00 PM or 9:45 from EPCOT. Now the breakfast buffet is a joke as well. The bath towels were like rags you would use to shine your shoes. The phone is never answered at the desk so you need to keep going down in person. The building they put us in was in an area that looked like it was right out of Harlem. DO NOT STAY HERE. I will be contacting DISNEY next to let them know that their affiliation with this hotel should be dropped it is absolutely a nightmare. And this website should be sued for false adverstisement.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Renee S
Reviews.Content: Room smelled as if someone had died in it. Transferred to new room which had water pouring out of ceiling in bathroom. Don't be fooled into paying extra for buffet breakfast because it turns out to be nothing more than continental which is free at most other motels. Worst stay of our lives!

Reviews.Title: “this place was something....... in 1975”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: First warning - if you are used to staying in 3 star or better hotels , you will be very dissappointed, so stay away. the title is very telling. This is an old time resort right out the the 1970's. multiple 2 story buildings with Outside doors, and the big windows over an AC unit. The property shows its age, no matter how much effor is put in to keeping up appearances, think of that past-her-prime single lady at the bar with the over dyed hair, too much makeup, and a dress style that is 2 generations younger than her. Not that there is anything wrong with that, but know what you are getting going into the relationship and you will both be happier for it. More speciifcs - metal railings (which have been repainted) stilll show rust and corrosion in multiple places - watch running you hand under the hand rails. teh gates to the pools are not level and scrape teh conrete making a racket everytime they are opened - even worn grooves on teh concrete. the metal fencing around the pool not very sturdy or straight. the door to our room was hard to shut (had to use key even when leaving) and still had to really force it to close. The condensation from the AC unit made the carpet near the door damp. Just to give you quick idea of the age issues. On the plus side - the rooms were clean. I was a bit skeptical of the cleanliness and did a "white socks" test by rubbing feet across the carpet with the whitest socks i had on. they came up surprisingly clean. There was a suspect light stain on one sheet. bathroom was clean. Teh grounds, altough dated, were clean. The pools were clean,and there was not trash around the complex. It had some nicer amenities, like a kids playground, multiple pools and hottubs, a "natural beach" with paddle boats, plus ball fields. I would not go to this property specifically for these amenities, but could be a plus for the right person. Teh number one advantage to this property is price - it was CHEAP!!!!! we paid less that 40 per night. For a just a place to rest your head after a long day at the theme parks, it was a great value. It was evident that was what everyone did, because the place was empty all day but the parking lot was full late at night. Take this same property and place it in most other cities, and i'd very suspect of the clientele. but i never felt nervous with a sketchy crowd. In fact, mostly newer, nicer cars in teh lot, and no nefarious looking types were ever seen hanging around. It was about a 15 min drive from disney - even with traffic, but would be on teh wrong side of town to be convenient to sea world or universal. There are lots of stores and restaraunts very close by. In summary, if you are looking just for the cheapest, but safe and clean, place to rest your head after a long day at the theme parks, this is not a bad choice. But know what you are getting into, or else could be very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Juliana O
Reviews.Content: Its a pitty to write not good things, specially when you are writting about your vacations, that should be a pleasent moment. But, this hotel let us down. At the biginning we arrived and a very rude frontdesk called Leticia told us that some boxes arriive there to us. We sent an email telling te hotel about these purchases weeks previous the trip, but nobody returned. And to our surpirse Leticia said that a fee os US$ 5 per box should be paid and that there was not a warehouse but a hotel. Yes, that was our reception at the first day. we negotiate the price, since we were not warned about thie fee when we sent an email telling the hotel about them. After that we went to the room, it was: --> Dirty (hair on bath, blood at the door...) --> The blanket was so dry and hard that seems a homeless blanket --> the bed was tiny and badly fit us (we are a small couple!!) --> all the furniture was old and the building need a goos manteinence Besides all that we discovery that no breakfast was included. I ting it worth paying a littel bit nore to stay at a good place, where you feel good, because its your holydays no?! A time to feel fine and not receive a angry face and words from Leticia.

Reviews.Title: “Not a champion!”
Reviews.Author: fineartfan
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at Champions World Resort via BookIt. Our first room never got below 80 degrees, even with the air conditioning blasting, so, after a very nice maintenance man came to check on it after midnight, we were assigned to a new room. The original room looked shabby and the sink was old and cracked. When we entered the second room, it smelled musty like the first one, since the a/c was turned off, but since this room's air conditioning unit wasn't digital, it seemed to work better than the previous one and we were able to get the air down to a manageable 75 degrees overnight. The sink was also in better shape. I put our drinks into the fridge to keep cool. I only got the fridge to make noise after I plugged the plug into another outlet, but in the morning we found out that despite the noise, it had not worked at all. Just for kicks, we also tried the safe, which did not lock and turned on the analog TV set, which featured just a few stations and a snowy picture. All in all, I have stayed at nicer Motel 6 properties, and there at least I was not expecting a "resort." A family who checked in before us had driven all the way from Indiana with two young children to spend their spring break week at this property. I felt bad for them that we all ended up in such a run-down motel, because I know Orlando has much nicer places available for comparable and even better prices. The staff person at check-in was quite slow, but the one at check-out apologized for us having to move rooms at 1 a.m. and was nice and efficient, and probably somewhat embarrassed by all of the things that did not work in our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1202
Reviews.Content: I stayed at champions from feb 16 to the 23..this I my second stay here. I went last year and loved it so much..for the price you can't go wrong. Service is great check in and check out no problems..I was givin a poolside room but asked to be changed to another and was switched no problem..my only complaint was how busy the hotel was...good for the hotel but my favorite spot th jacuzzi was always packed and my second to last day I realy needed to soak in it but the jets weren't working bc some idiot turned the knob the wrong way and broke it..I don't understand whypeople complain about this hotel everythin about this place is great and for the price you can't beat it..trust me I wouldn't go back if it wasn't a great plce..don't listen to ppl whoost bad reviews they just want a 5 star hotel for a 3 star price...stay here u won't regret it

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant and great prices”
Reviews.Author: Lucylou27
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and both times have been totally trouble free. We stayed for 10 nights and had no problems. The room was clean and was cleaned every day, towels and bed sheets changed we came back every day to a spotless room. We only seen reception staff to check in and out but they seemed friendly enough and there were no additional charges over what we paid when we booked. The location is exellent, took about 10 mins to get to disney and about 20 mins to Universal and Seaworld. Aircon and tv worked well and there was always a parking space outside our room despite the hotel being quite busy over spring break. I will definatly stay here again if back in Orlando :)

Reviews.Title: “horrible customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: julia m
Reviews.Content: the room was ok we did find one roach in the bathroom there was a constant foul odor and construction going on upstairs that woke us up every morning but thats not even my complaint seeing as how we got the room for $29 a night what can you expect we wanted to stay another couple of days so we could drive to the beach and have somewhere to stay that night the lady at the front desk told me to buy another voucher from the half off depot for the $29 a night room rate and i could just renew and rebook the same room so i spent my last allotment of hotel money purchasing the voucher when i went to redeem it she told me i had to call the reservation number so i did which just transfered me right back to her she then proceeded to tell me i just wasted my money and have no where to stay because they cant accept the vouchers until after april 15th i asked her why they accepted my previous vouchers for my current stay she said it was a mistake so now we have nowhere to stay for the night and stuck with a voucher we will never use! the maid staff were exceptionally nice they need to have them working at the front desk and the front desk people cleaning the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Slice of heaven on a trip from hell”
Reviews.Author: Mystery_Traveler_0
Reviews.Content: We like Champions. I recently had the opportunity to visit over 17 orlando hotels in one night (Champions was booked solid) and we were thrilled when we were able to come back to Champions after the seeing what else is out there. We stayed in left side of the property for the first time and it appeared to have been aquired at a different time than the main property so it has slightly different layout and upgraded AC units. Rooms looked to be newly renovated. Some of the rooms near the pool area have nice tile floors with large 12inch tiles a nice feature for folks with allergies as there is no carpet! Cleaning staff this time around was not as good they did not get to our room till late very late in the day and were noisy with their carts going up and down. However overall like I said after seeing what was else was out there Champions is still top notch for the price! Side note: In my visit to the other hotels I found that when hotels started booking up some raised their rates by $60+ a night!!! When asked about the discrepancy with prices posted on the signs one clerk was honest and said the boss called and said he heard other properties were filling up and raised the rate for the night! Now I wont mention names here but let say that Champions DID NOT DO THIS they kept their same rates and were great folks to work with!

Reviews.Title: “We had to switch hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Maisy S
Reviews.Content: We tried to like this place, we really did but we had to leave on our 2nd night instead of on the 4th night! It is a run-down version of a La Quinta Inn and the crows that stays there is terrible! The receptionist told me that since theuir bar is open to everyone, they can't really control who comes in or out. We felt really unsafe coming back at night. Our room was by the pool and there were some low-lives who would hassle anyone that would walk by. We even saw 2 men throwing beer bottles from one of the 2nd floor buildings! Felt very unsafe and we looked for another hotel to go to. For a family with kids, I would not reccomend this hotel at all!

Reviews.Title: “RACCOONS?!?!?!?!?”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Your experience at champions world resort will depend on your personal preferences. We're not big nature lovers but if you love RACCOONS scratching at your door in the middle of the night, on the second floor, then this is the place for you. Do you love the show "how it's made"? Because you'll love how you have to push through a sea of laundry carts and an open/DIRTY laundry room to get to your room. Like swimming in lakes? Well don't worry! At champions the pool is JUST as dirty as a lake. You'll for sure get sick. Security is a priority for many people, at champions, the one guy walking the halls all hours of the night with pillows will make you feel right at home. Also, when we checked in, our door was wide open.... It's always welcoming have to enter your room with a tazor gun for protection. Overall, I would rather sleep on the street then have to stay at Champions World Resort ever again. Make sure to put your "No Moleste" sign on the door! Happy Traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty/Got Poisonous Spider Bite!”
Reviews.Author: elrn50
Reviews.Content: This hotel was old and dirty. I really didn't feel like sleeping in the bed; the sheets and floors were dirty! My daughter got bit by a poisonous spider while sleeping (went to the Dr. to verify it and get antibiotics). We will never return.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: Brandi L
Reviews.Content: I check into my room and had to change my own sheets 3 out of 4 of the beds the first night we were there hair ALL over sheets holes in blankets and hair in tub..Are rooms were only cleaned 1 day out of 4 which was the day we were gona allday , we went to Disney we left are Ipod are room and it came up missing and they never even made a report...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: justaflagirl
Reviews.Content: As with most people I was nervous about staying at this hotel because of some of the negative comments but I found there was nothing to worry about. Check in staff was very friendly, as was the check out staff. And each time we called to the front desk with a question, they were very friendly and helpful. There is a $7 per diem for ammenities which is to cover parking, use of pools, etc. There are 3 nice pools and 1 hot tub which is VERY HOT. The room and bathroom was really clean and both very spacious. It had an in-room mini fridge and a microwave. There were only three of issues that I had which were not too bad. First, the hair dryer did not work at all. Second, the water in the shower fluctuated from hot to warm to cold, over and over. But I learned if you turned the hot down a touch, it stopped. Third, the cleaning staff was very loud out in the corridors. We stayed up all night at the Extra Disney Day event so it was after 7am when we got back to the room to sleep. We had our Do Not Disturb sign on the door and they didn't disturb the room but their carts going up and down the corridor sounded like a freight train and the workers yelled loudly to each other, which we could hear in our room. Once they were gone, we were able to sleep again. Overall I think the stay was very nice and I would definietly refer this motel to others and stay here myself, as well. After all, you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “It was what it was...which worked for me!!”
Reviews.Author: GJSimion
Reviews.Content: We do not go to a hotel to stay at the hotel the entire time. I believe we got what we asked for. The room appeared to be clean enough for my taste. No bugs, no ants, no moving safe, no smell different than any other smell, no bed that closed back over me. Might they all be here...yea I guess. Was the room worn in spots...yes. The door was a bit worn...I saw locks on other rooms that were unusable.......the sink was crack in the bottom......the walkways were noisy when people walked on them. But hey for what I paid AND what I wanted to invest in lodging for our vacation...my family said this is where we will stay next year. The room was taken care of by the maid service enough by my standards(they did not wake me up). While the A/C was a bit noisy....I like white noise. ! And Tamara at the front desk was kind and helpful. And the nature area was great...real old school! May all of the complaints in the reviews be valid....Yea but for me this worked. See you all next year..same time same place..GJ

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs infested!!!!!!!!"”
Reviews.Author: lotaluv
Reviews.Content: The room smelled like mothballs the room had not only bedbugs but roaches the smell of the room was horrid they started construction on all the first floor rooms because of the buggs they charge you an extra seven dollars a day to use there're amenities it was a dirty hotel I would not recommened this hotel to anyone I guess the saying is true you get what u paid for oh yeah they had a bedbug sniffing dog checking the rooms that was a scare in its self and they tried to hide the dog DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL..........

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: tbryant11
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were on our first vacation together which was also our honeymoon. Upon check in they couldn't find our reservations & asked if we canceled ( yeah that's why we're here to check in. :/ when you do check in, pay attention to the framed notice conveniently positioned at the end of the counter facing away from you that states they charge a $50 deposit, that we found out after it overdrafts our account which made us lose out on an already payed for day at universal. When i asked to see what i had been charged for, their computers were conveniently down & no one got back to me about anything. The room was OK, but smelled musty. Towels were very rough and no water pressure. Our safe had batteries held in by ductape, & you could take the whole thing & open it at your leisure since it wasn't bolted down. The hot tub didn't work the first three days and the heating system in the heated pool didn't work so water was freezing. The nature park was the only nice thing pleasing to be at. The food was pathetic , only the fresh made eggs looked food, but didn't see one employee EVER wash their hands let alone use hand Sanitizer. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: stu121
Reviews.Content: this was our first time to Florida and not to sure what to expect and reading reviews a bit concerned but i would say that the majority of these reviews are incorrect and as a number of people say you get what you pay for if you want 5 star then stay at Animal Kingdom! Anyway back to my review Good Points 1, rooms kept clean daily with fresh towels 2. all pools and areas clean 3. bar service was great especially Carlos and his great cocktails! 4. stayed for breakfast a few times again great service from Kim and excellent omelette bar. 5. fields and beach at back of hotel was a great place to relax 6. good gift shop with a very friendly owner Negative Points 1. need to hire car when here unless you want to rely on shuttle services which in some cases had very mad drivers !! 2. WFI not operational all the time But overall very happy holiday,

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: DUNY F
Reviews.Content: I love how the many of the reviewers expect this to be a 5 star hotel, you get what you pay for. I stayed there this past weekend and was terrified due to some reviews i read, once i got there and checked in and finally got to the room i couldnt believe it, the room was so nice, clean , no carpet no mold in the bathroom. Everything seemed remolded, people here are complaining about the smallest things, food, noise and what not, that happens in every freaking place you stay. The rooms come with a fridge and microwave, so if you dont want to waste money at breakfast or food at all you can always buy a few things and the hundreds of walmarts that are around town and save some cash. This place was amazing would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “happy with my stay:)”
Reviews.Author: karina m
Reviews.Content: me and my family of 5 stayed at champions world resort for 3 night's. our stay was a great one. we had no problems , the room was clean . and best of all the front desk staff was great they helped me with what i needed . i would stay here again for sure. thank's for the great stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: IainRWB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon in November 2011. We were advised on arrival that our room had been upgraded due to our celebration, though you worry about what the original room might have been like as there were no particular luxuries in the one we had. That said, we wanted a no-frills base for visiting attractions and that is what we got. The bar was great, the meals were superb and I can't recommend the steak highly enough - a huge slab of meat for not a lot of money. Breakfast was simple and we usually ate it in a rush to catch the next shuttle out, but tasty and satisfying. It was slightly overpriced, however. The transport to the theme parks was really straightforward (if rigid in timing) which was great, but if we wanted to go elsewhere it meant a lot of expensive taxi rides. It is worth considering before booking just how you plan to get to the places you want to visit. This location is great for Disney, but less so for Universal and the retail outlets. Overall we were pleased with our stay and would recommend anyone looking to base themselves in the Kissimmee area to strongly consider this resort.

Reviews.Title: “We had a GREAT time!!”
Reviews.Author: prowe57
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a family vacation (8 adults and 7 children) at the Champions World Resort. We had an awesome time!! The staff at the front desk were very friendly and very responsive. Our remote was not working so my mother and I walked to the front desk. By the time we got back to the room, maintenance had been there to replace the remote. The rooms looked like they were recently been remodeled and, most importantly with several families with small children, the rooms, carpet and bathrooms were very clean. Housekeeping was attentive to our needs as well. The property had 3 pools, a sports field, a play ground, paddle boats and it looked like an outdoor movie one of the nights we were there. In my opinion, this property was WELL worth the money, which was a very inexpensive way to go in Orlando. Thank you all at the Champions World Resort.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Charles F
Reviews.Content: As a family we go to Orlando for weekends 6+ times a year and we decided to go off of our normal routine and try the Champions World Resort. Since there were 5 of us we opted for the largest "advertised room" they offered. It was standard sized crammed with a folding couch. The put us is the building furthest back on the property, no problem, it showcased their nice sports facilities. The food was pricey for what you get at the restaurant, the karaoke is too loud and goes until midnight so forget a quiet drink. The pool was nice, if it wasn't for the men who were having a softball tournament smoking & drinking in the pool itself, when informed about it the staff did nothing. When we arrived we went to Publix and got donuts for the next morning breakfast, next morning the bathroom & mini fridge were covered with spider-ants. But...you get what you pay for. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Elle R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before and this time I wanted to share my experience. This hotel is a nice property. They have plenty of parking, well maintained grounds, nice front desk staff, a gift shop that unexpectedly had the milk I needed for my baby. The pools was clean and warm, the room was larger than others in the area- it was clean and nicely furnished. For the price you get much more than other area hotels. I like the location the most. It is close enough to Disney, yet far enough away from the crazy hype of Rt.192. The pool closes at 11pm and the security keeps things nice and quiet. I will return again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This is hardly a resort”
Reviews.Author: novisfamily
Reviews.Content: The website and brochure looked nice but actually it was a motel and nothing more. We had to be moved room as the whole floor we were on was infested with ants. They were in our cupboards and clothes and bed - it was horrific. The karaoke goes on loudly til midnight so make sure your room is away from that. All in all we were thoroughly disappointed and would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back...”
Reviews.Author: Reodor
Reviews.Content: We (Myself + Wife + Daughter, 4 yrs) stayed at this hotel when visiting Disney World. We stayed for one night and did only spend 8 hours (sleeping 6 of them) at the hotel in total. The room was shabby and not very clean. You could hear more or less everything that your neighbours talked about except for when the air conditioning was on, then you couldn't hear what you were thinking yourself :) The rooms looks much better at the website than in real life. To summarize I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, the only positive was that it was cheap, 35 USD per night.

Reviews.Title: “Budget and nice too”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant for me and my son nice sized bed each room was cleaned daily and nothing was too much trouble for the staff pools areas clean and plenty of pool towels round the heated pool. TV basic and reasonable pic quality and kept us happy when we got back from theme parks if on a budget then this place rocks nice food near by would recommend and would use agian this was our 11th visit too florida stayed in both hotel and villas

Reviews.Title: “my clothes still smells like moth balls”
Reviews.Author: Denilson B
Reviews.Content: awful place to stay the price the give me when i make the reservation change that day the i check out THEY WILL CHARGE YOU FEES FOR THE RESORT they don't mention to you when you do the reservation the rooms smell like moth ball a will stay and you clothes food is hard to breath with the smell not worth it run run run

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pathetic hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Noyi
Reviews.Content: We went to Florida for our dream vacation at Disney.When we reached this hotel which we had booked in advance,it was nowhere close to the ratings it has on the website.The building is very shabby and almost on the road.The rooms are horrible,smelly and damp,dirty and worn out linen and noisy and old beds.We had booked through our miles so we went back to the front desk to get our check out statement.Can you believe it the staff was so rude that this lady simply refused to give us our document .....simply horrible experience pl don't go here ,won't even suggest it to any enemy!!

Reviews.Title: “A poorly maintained resort”
Reviews.Author: DawnFromNY
Reviews.Content: This resort is poorly maintained: 1. the staircases are dirty 2. the carpet is dirty 3. the telephone misses several buttons 4. the wireless did not work 5. several times, no one answered the phone when I called the front desk 6. you can easily hear people talking next room 7. the fitness room is very small and the treadmill did not work I would not come back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “for the price excellent value”
Reviews.Author: robert m
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks uptill 29th December, 2011. Having read previous good an bad reports. I found the staff all friendly and attentive to any problems I had. Reception staff in particular. My room or should I say rooms as I was moved due a broken cable to the TV both rooms were excellent, and cleaned every day and towels etc replaced. I agree with other comments the buffet breakfast is vastly overpriced for the selection offered. The bar prices were good, I met several regulars who use the bar and found them very friendly if sometimes a bit loud. Dont expect a five star hotel (as some people seem to) every place they stay. Good value for somwhere to put your head down whilst enjoying the Parks. One Bonus Kara behind the bar she was brilliant. I better mention Mark the barman good and efficient but, remember Mark guests are just as important as your regulars, dont ignore them.

Reviews.Title: “Place is not bad for the price---BUT----”
Reviews.Author: Donliberty
Reviews.Content: We checked in for 3 nights...Dec 17-19... The rooms are a little run down but clean... I must say they are always cleaning...There were a few bugs in the room....But this is Florida.. Nothing major,,, The Pools are nice and clean.... The Breakfast buffet is something you can skip.... Not worth the price and very limited food items... It was luke warm.... The Major problem was the internet access... From the first day there until we leaved we could not get on there wireless connection... When i went to the front desk they told me every day that it was down and they were working on it.... This for me was an inconvience because i needed to do work!!! DO NOT COUNT ON WIRELESS CONECTION THAT THEY CLAIM TO HAVE.. I think i may have gotten a virus from trying to log on also...... Having major problem with my laptop since i left there....Once nice thing was there free bus to Epcot,,,, Very convienient.. All in all not too bad a place the price,,,, You get what you pay for.......!!

Reviews.Title: “Call ahead”
Reviews.Author: Charley1974
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from 8 Dec-11 Dec the first 2 nights were very loud and annoying as High School Football Teams were staying there too some 50 plus Schools from all over and these kids were rude and loud all Hours of the night however I was warned by the hotel staff at check in so I took my chances. the room were clean everyday and the pillows were very small which sucks if you have neck or back problems the TV was and old tube model and the channel selection wasn't the greatest so if you were trying to relax and watch a little TV after a long day you will be a little disappointed ,we were in a room that wasn't refurbished yet but I cant tell for sure if any of the other rooms were either. the pool was fun for my kids just make sure you check that the pool area has towels other wise just bring some from your room.this hotel has a shuttle service for Disney only and they post the pick up times for you at check in. I recommend you drive if you have your own Vehicle other wise you'll be waiting till late to be picked up.this hotel is about 15-20 mins drive to Disney and 30 mins for Universal if you do drive. this hotel is definetly worth the price you pay it is what it is so don't expect 4 star accomidations on a 2 star price I have stayed all over the Orlando,Kissimee,Lake Buena Vista area and this Hotel wasn't bad by any means I think this hotel needs a little TLC and an upgrade to all of its facilities the staff was very nice and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a fixed vacation budget. just make sure you call ahead and make sure there isn't a bunch of high school kids staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: this is our second year doing an overnight stay. Last year, we spent so much money for a hotel that we literally just crashed for the night. The checkin was long and we didn't even enjoyed any of the hotels facilities.. This year I searched for something more affordable, that would still be near Disney World. Champion World Resorts was Great. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly, the checkin was quick, and parking was only steps away from the room. I also liked that it was so close to restaurants and shops. I will defitnetly want to stay here again and enjoy the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: andy t
Reviews.Content: just got back from a eight day stay at the resort, we were worried about the bad reviews but decided that they had improved since september, so we took a chance. The motel in its self was good, the rooms were cleaned daily and the place had been refurbished. We asked for a pool side room which was good. We were made very welcome by the receptionist Latisha, who looked after us and gave us advice on local places.Check in/check out was easy. The only down side was we werent advised that there was a junior american football tournament on and that there was 50 teams staying , the noise was unbearable at times and the lack of supervision by their staff meant that some of the youths were running around making noise until 1 am.So check with the hotel ref whats on during your stay. A good motel for the price .We would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Back to Disney we go!”
Reviews.Author: Vaca2011
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the disney theme parks and we stayed in a Great value room. My check in was quick- and since it was a slow week they even were able to check us in early! The staff was pleasant and the check in process was smooth. Our room was just as it looks in the picture. I like the warm colors and decorative pictures. Housekeeping was always thorough & clean- it was a great week! For the price you can't beat this place. Its so close to the Disney parks! Another great feature is the playground and gated pool, its a great place to let the kids run free. I really enjoyed my stay and will return again hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk ..”
Reviews.Author: Freddie23000
Reviews.Content: It was a long night and I really needec to get some sleep.. When I arrive to.the hotel the first person I saw was Eli. She was as sweet n caring. She smile all the time she made me feel like I was at home :) every time I came To front desk she was there.smiling away great costumes.service...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: jmr8491
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this hotel every visit we make to Disney. The staff are friendly and helpful and their prices are unmatched!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!!! Great hotel!! Love it”
Reviews.Author: Love073009
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend and loved it since saw it from the street! The rooms were just as showed on pictures and everything was great! House keeping was very attentive! Would stay here in a heart beat!! Love ittt!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Scary as Hell!”
Reviews.Author: Jack T
Reviews.Content: From the fellow reviews about this property on Trip Advisor, I knew to expect the place to be a bit shabby. I will admit I have pretty high standards. That being said there are things I can deal with and things I absolutely will not. The Champions Resort pushes my limits when it comes to where I am actually willing to sleep. Tired doesn't even beging to describe this place. (However, I don't believe one can give a bad review based solely on appearance.) I checked into my room and when I opened the door i was hit with the smell of a moldy wet towel. The room was saturated with the scent. It was totally overpowering and gross. As I ventured further into the room, it was just plain nasty, stained couch, marked up dresser.... As I went to climb into bed, I pulled off the duvet cover and found that the blanket underneath was merely the remnant of another blanket that had once existed. The satin border that it was obvious that the blanket once had, was cut off and the blanket was still being used! There were only two pillows provided. I will give them kuddos on the pillows, they were comfortable. However the beds were incredibly tiny! I am a small person there is no way a second person could have fit into the bed as well. The grounds of the hotel are incredibly shabby! While there are two pools, I felt that I would need a full round of vaccinations before I swam in either of them. Not to mention that the furniture by the pool was disgustingly filthy! You could not pay me to go anywhere near either of the pools! Speaking of outside, the real low point in my stay was seeing an employee push a stolen grocery cart from the Target store down the street as a utility cart around the grounds! This place was what nightmares are made of! No joke. While this hotel was incredibly nasty in appearance, it was evident how hard the housekeeping staff worked to make sure my room was clean. As gross as this place was, it was relatively clean. My bottom line, never stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaJP
Reviews.Content: Its a nice deal for people that are on a budget. The hotel is very close to the Walt Disney World, staff was very friendly and helpful. The only bad thing is that in order to use their internet connection I had to leave the room which was on the second building, far from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Had an awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: ChristainM
Reviews.Content: I stayed October 15-20 at first I was skeptical after seeing reviews but enjoyed my stay. The lady that checked me in was very nice and professional and she was very well dressed other than some. She went out her way to help me, since I have a disabled family member, she was the only one I wanted to deal with us because everyone else seemed preoccupied. I believe her name was Letasha. In my eyes she deserves a raise or reward for being so understanding and helpful. She really improved and made my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Was a good stay (apart from the Junior Baseball Team)”
Reviews.Author: Steph G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Champions World Resort for two weeks, was a bit sceptical after reading previous reviews on this site but the negative ones were not justified as the hotel was very good. The staff were lovely and very helpful. The only problem with the place was the timing of our stay. The one piece of advice I would give to people is not to stay there between 12th October and 26th October as they had a junior baseball team staying there (they were in the same block as myself and my husband). They were very inconsiderate and their behaviour was antisocial to say the least. They were loud and banging on doors at 4-5am in the morning when they were going out and when they came in at night (sometimes after midnight) they did the same. We complained when checking out because we thought they had gone some days when they didn't come back until late. Apart from that we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a awesome stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ana C
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 10 days, and I most definitely am going back next year. My room was cleaned everyday and fresh towels placed out for me. The staff was always courteous and friendly. The recent renovations by the new owners are great and i can't wait to see what new improvements come next year. I loved the heated pool and the patio area where you can just lay back and relax after a luxurious swim. I"m definitely making this hotel a yearly stopover. The front desk staff provided excellent customer services,as well Margarita at night very helpful when we asked questions about tickets, breakfast, as well furnishing us with a taxi to the airport. Breakfast was great and the Cook Carmen making her special eggs sandwiches. I look forward in returning soon. Had lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Review on Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nagaraju k
Reviews.Content: I am very happy to stay in Champoins worold resort.Customer service is very help full. Rental is cheap and best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Wava H
Reviews.Content: Great value - clean, reasonable price, very helpful staff. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent motel but front desk staff was rude”
Reviews.Author: unnamed_1
Reviews.Content: Whatever you may imagine when you hear the word "resort," the Champions World Resort is not it. What it is, is a very decent motel, that is clean, relatively modern (probably well renovated), and inexpensive. I would have given them 4 stars, were it not for the front desk staff. The lady checking us in was rather brisk and passive aggressive -- I did not pay attention, figuring I must have said something to provoke this (although I could not guess what). Later I discovered that the Wi-Fi signal was very weak in our room and went to the lobby to use the Internet there. (From my laptop, mind you -- they charge for the use of their old PC by the minute, something like $0.40/min, if I remember correctly.) While in the lobby, I could not help but overhear 4 or 5 parties of guests checking in and each case I had a hard time believing my ears -- each of the two ladies staffing the front desk that night was outright rude and seemed to have no concept of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Lourdes L My experience in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lourdes L
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Kissimmee. I have visited this hotel five times this year. The whole family enjoyed the stay there. Everything is near by. I am going there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Rude Staff at Check in and making copies of your ID.”
Reviews.Author: Dennis M
Reviews.Content: These are not the type of people that you want to have copies of your ID. The rooms are very basic. It near Animal Kingdom. Th e staff would rather be any where eles except helping you. Just smile at the front desk lady when you check in. I don't understand why she would even roll of out of bed. You will be able to tell she really hates her job and people.

Reviews.Title: “My experience in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazyboy114
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in Kissimmee. It is a Instead super comfortable, accessible parks and disney all the best places you can eat in your vacation. The attention is very satisfactory. I have two Sometimes visiting this hotel and will not be the last. since its price and the comfort of your rooms make your stay a very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “I Shall Return!”
Reviews.Author: VoltesV18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 wks. The 1st rm that we were in was dirty but asked to be move bec. the tv wasnt working. The 2nd rm was very clean w/c comes w/ microwave and a cooler with no exctra charge. Dont shop in the gift store if you dont want to deal w/ a grumpy old man. The area was excellent if you only plan to visit Disney. The hotel provide a free shuttle to Magic Kingdom & Epcot if you dont want to rent a car & pay 14 dollars/day for parking @Disney. From MK you can take a free bus or monorail anywhere around Disney Facilities. The shuttle charge15 dollars / person to Universal and sea world which is a little too much if there is 4 in the family. However there is a taxi service (united cab) that you can call that charge lot less than the shuttle or other cab company. The strip in which the hotel is located is excellent for souvenir shopping. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel which can take you shopping along that strip. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Iburntmytoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks, when we arrived they had only one reservation for us, the receptionist was a little rude and grumpy, but it got sorted. the rest of the staff were very helpful and friendly. the rooms all though a little dated are very clean, the beds are so comfy, we were the only people in our block so had the pool to ourselves! there are three very well maintained pools and jacuzzi"s. theres transport to all parks, the universal one leaves a little early for me...7.30am which means a long day if you get tired, coach picks up at 6pm, you can get the lynx bus for 2 dollars to kissimmee old town which is a good night out, or for 8 dollars return go to the florida mall, dont get a taxi as its $85.00, the bus takes an hour. theres an all you can eat chinese across the road, a dominos, pizza hut , mcdonalds, garage ( for beer ) if you walk 5 minutes further the walgreens pharmacy is like a supermarket. The breakfast was a little ropey to be honest, but if you walk to houlihans 5 mins down the road, they do the best breakfast, very very friendly and the best steak we have ever had, the biggest mountain of nachos ever. whilst im here, get a bus 10 minutes to the next town and stop at wildside grill...yum i had the most tastiest pasta ever, followed by fried ,,yes fried cheesecake, you have to try it xxx Back to the hotel, its best to hire a car as the hotel is close to disney and 20 mins from universal, the shuttle picks you up first so you have to go to every other hotel to pick up, which means its an hour to disney and 1.5 hours to universal ( num bum ) and it can get packed on the return from universal...32 people standing!! the hotel is a little far out from the next big towns, but can be reached by bus or taxi, theres a bar that sells bargin buckets of beer, and a little shop in the hotel. i would stay agai, worth the money x

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cheap clean hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ELawton
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel, we arrived in the morning & left our bags & used their free shuttle bus to Disney! Jose helped us get reasonably priced Disney tickets & everyone was very helpful. When we arrived back on the free shuttle bus we were amazed at the quality of service & how nice the rooms were as we paid a low room rate but we were very very impressed. The shower worked well & mini toiletries & a hairdryer were provided. The TV & remote worked and there was a fridge & microwave. Everything was excellent. In the morning we checked out & my friend ate the breakfast but I did not. The cooked food looked like it had been sat there a while & wasn't to my taste but they did have a fresh egg station making omlettes or any eggs you fancied which looked good & a cereal station. Breakfast came to about $10 with a drink including tax. Then we left our bags & went on the free shuttle bus to the Lake Buena Vista mall, this was on time & an excellent service. The only downpoint was that the bag drop was not secure but it was in a separate room off the lobby & at least there was a place to leave them. Overall an extremely good hotel, perfect for Disney & excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: adriana m
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year. I like the hotel, its clean, the employees are very nice and the prices are great. I will continue to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a rainy weekend. But the accommodations were fit for the price. The room was clean, although we turned down one of the beds and there were a pair of undies. We wrote a not for them to take them but they only folded them . Still cleaned the room well. Front Desk was very nice, and offered bar and karaoke. Would go back when on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money Spent!!”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa S
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay and expected with the rate a nice place to sleep and nothing else! The rooms were recently remodeled and very nice!! The pool was nice and the restaurants food was good!! Well worth the small price we paid!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: cypanadero
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2010 for 3 nights while visiting with family before we set onto a cruise. From the outset it looked like a decent property, it has a nice front desk, nice staff, bar/lounge, small workout facility, convenience store and 2 pools located on the premise. It was also within walking distance of many nearby restaurants including Pizza Hut and a Chinese buffet which we ate at. The rooms on the other hand were another story. Unless they have done some extensive renovations in the past year, the room smelt like a musty thrift store and that smell was deeply entrenched into the rooms furniture, beds, linen, pillows, blankets, carpets etc. It was gross and it was not pleasant to sleep on something with such a foul odor. The rooms appear to not have been renovated or touched since the 80s and the only good thing I found about the room was that the shower had good water pressure. Even If you are not picky about where you stay and are on a budget, I remain hesitant to recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Met basic needs”
Reviews.Author: nicmicj
Reviews.Content: First off, we stayed at Champions World Resort due to a "free" trip we had from a timeshare presentation we attended. It was not our first choice of hotels. We arrived at the hotel around 10:30pm. It is near the far end of Highway 192 but not too out of the way. When we entered the lobby, we were greeted by two of the receptionists. They were very nice and quickly checked us in to our rooms. Upon getting to our room, we did find it clean. Yes, the rooms are dated but it met our basic needs - a clean place to sleep! You can tell that this is an older hotel by the decor, tv, carpet and squeaky beds. We did not find any types of bugs during our entire stay and the maid cleaned our room every day. The beds were kind of small and they do not seem to have any rooms with just one king bed so my husband and I shared a bed which seemed to be a full size - and was kind of squeaky and not as comfortable. The rooms also had a small microwave and mini fridge which are useful. What can I say about the Wi-Fi......a piece of crap. It took about 10 minutes just to get logged into the wifi and then we could not access anything else or it took about 10 minutes to change screens. My husband really needed the wifi because he is an online professor. The 2nd day, he finally went to the lobby and had no problems getting a connection and being able to do a little work. There are limited channels on the TV but the restaurant in the lobby had more channels including ESPN. They also do Karaoke Friday & Saturday nights, but we did not participate in that. One of the hotel guests also said their food was pretty good as well. The pool area looked nice but we did not go swimming during our stay. There is plenty of parking on the grounds. We didn't have any problems as far as not feeling safe here. It is not what we are normally accustomed to and probably would not stay here again if I had to choose, but overall, decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Pia D
Reviews.Content: Looking at the pictures and amenities listed on their website, you would think that you were staying at a clean and well-kept RESORT. However, upon our arrival we realized this was not the case. We arrived before the check in time of 3:00, at 12:20 and asked if we could check in any earlier. The manager was rude and said to return in an hour. An hour later, she said we would have to wait until 2:30. This was not a problem, but her attitude definitely was! When we entered our room it did not look like it had been cleaned, besides for the beds being made, and there was a mildew/musty odor. There were bugs and hair on the bathroom floor and a large gap underneath the door, which allowed bugs to crawl in. The carpet was old and looked as if it was not vacuumed. The comforters and blankets on the beds were stained and appeared to be very worn out and old. I immediately removed them from the bed and placed them on the old stained couch, in this so-called "Deluxe Room." Our room lock would not lock automatically at times and the extra security bolt was dangling on by one screw. When we called the front desk about the bolt and lock they said it would be taken care of, but in our 3-night visit it was not repaired. The grounds were not well maintained and the pools did not appear clean. We did not even venture in them because the water was not crystal clear and it was nearly impossible to see the bottom. Overall, this resort (aka motel) was not what we expected! I would recommend finding other accommodations, as we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Strikey300
Reviews.Content: Nice and cheap hotel. 10 minutes from Disneyworld, 20 minutes to Seaworld and 30 minutes from Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Champions World Resort, June 2011”
Reviews.Author: vichold
Reviews.Content: Had booked 2 rooms in the Champions World Resort, when we arrived, the front desk only wanted to give us one room.We got are two rooms but they told us we could not have joining rooms which we had asked for, eventually thay managed to find us joining rooms. Hassle you don't really need after a long flight. The main reason I would not go back to this motel is due to the unhelpful manner of the check in staff, on another occassion I wanted change for the laundry and they refused to give me any. This motel is fine for a cheap motel, we found the rooms to be clean, the maid was a lovely person and really put herslf out to ensure the rooms were kept to a good standard. The hotel does a breakfast but you have to pay for it and it is nothing much, would be better going somewhere else for your breakfast. I noticed that all the american guests got the best rooms at the back of the motel where it is much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: glynisw449
Reviews.Content: Myself and two grandchildren stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago for 2 weeks. After reading up about it an seeing a few bad reviews I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. It has three lovely big pools, one under cover which is heated. A hot tub. Rooms clean an acceptable for the money we paid. Clean towels every day if requested. The pictures on their site do not do it justice. Close by is a selection of eating places. We were made to feel very welcome and nothing was to much when we requested assistance of any sort. Jenny on reception was tops. Thank you Champions for a very memorable stay...

Reviews.Title: “august 2011”
Reviews.Author: kathryn t
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what we had expected. It was cheap. The room was clean and comfortable. The staf were reasonably helpful. The ony thing hat was better than expected was the maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, decent place and not as bad as some reviewers make out”
Reviews.Author: Davlyn1234
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about staying here after reading other reviews on this site but thankfully we had no problems. I'm presuming the room we stayed in was a refurbished one as almost everything looked new. The accommodation had a new beds, furniture and the paintwork throughout was spotless as though it had just been decorated. The bathroom looked new as there was no staining or anything anywhere. There was a sink unit in the bathroom and another just outside - handy when travelling with a family. The room facilities included a microwave, fridge, coffee maker, hairdryer, iron & ironing board and toiletries. We had maid service daily and the rooms were always clean and tidy when we returned from a day out. My only issue was the carpet, it was very rarely vacuumed and looked dirty. If it was vacuumed daily, I think it would help eliminate this issue, although I do think it was in need of a good clean. I have read a review on this site stating care needs to be taken with valuables due to theft by house keeping staff, we had no issues whatsoever with regard to this, in fact we had on a number of occasions left valuables and money on show and they were not touched. The covered pool was clean and heated, very welcoming and soothing after a day walking around theme parks (open 8am - 11pm). There is a further pool in another block also clean and heated, which is quieter than the covered pool. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, check-in smooth and quick, we had no issues. We did not use the hotel's restaurant, bar or shop so can't comment on this. We did use the laundry $2 per wash and $2 for the dryer. Handy if you're travelling with a family and not as much laundry to do once you're back home! We had a hire car so did not use any of the transport the hotel provides to the theme parks, so can't comment on this. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel which goes to all the attractions nearby and on International Drive, etc if you do not have your own transport. There are shops and places to eat nearby and some within a couple of minutes walking distance - Dominoes pizza, chinese buffet, MacDonalds, Walgreens, Seven Eleven. I would say though, a car is a must for quickness and ease for visiting anywhere in Orlando. The hotel grounds are a little sad - gardens could do with a bit of tender loving care. Surrounding area's are clean and tidy and we regularly saw hotel staff cleaning and tending the grounds but the hotel is old so walkways and stairwells are showing their age but there's nothing much the hotel can do about this. All in all, do not worry about the bad reviews. The hotel is being refurbished so if you are in an old room, ask to move to a better one! If you want the Ritz, go and pay the money. This is a motel, not 5 star accommodation Hope you have a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place We Stay When We Go Down There!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RobinSader
Reviews.Content: My son plays travel hockey We are always on the road. Although it means an extra 45 minutes traveling time each way Champions World Resort is the only place we will stay! From the minute you step into the lobby the staff is there making you feel at home. I have cancer and sometimes can be cranky they never get upset. If there is a problem all we have to do is pick up the phone and they are right there making it right. The rooms are very clean. never have I walked in to smell any odors of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel ... would stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reading2travellers
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be clean and the staff friendly. The location is good for the Disney Parks, and everything was in easy reach. The rooms were spacious, beds comfy and the air-con worked a treat. There is a laundry room on site, which is very handy. The heated pool is under cover and very inviting. All in all, a good hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: guylove62
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience, two rooms very clean. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER COME BACK!”
Reviews.Author: KATRINA R
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the worst ever.i found two waterbugs in my rm.beds were so old,bathroom was so dirty found so hair on floors,found rat dropping,also found toe nail clipings on the floor near the bed. myfamilyand i had three rms paid in full for eight nights check out on the second.poll was dirty my husband got a rash from it.it was just a awful hotel.DIRTY.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it”
Reviews.Author: bridgette l
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter and niece for a few days. Everything was clean. The A/C worked great. Noise was at a minimum. The pools were great. The convenience store and restaurant were the most reasonably priced that I've seen in a hotel in a long time. FREE shuttle to Disney which arrived right on time. Will definitely go back & recommend to friends & family. I must say that I'm glad I went - after reading some reviews I was skeptical & checked for bed bugs before bringing anything else into the room. Sometimes I have to wonder if the people leaving reviews actually stayed in the same place. It seemed to me that updates were being made. Fresh paint in some places. Some of the flooring even looked new. The store just opened on August 1st. The room decor is a little outdated but I'm sure if it wasn't then you surely wouldn't get the deal that you are getting. Our sink was slow in draining & within 5 minutes of me calling the front desk maintenance was at my door & it was fixed right then.

Reviews.Title: “Fam Bierens uit Holland”
Reviews.Author: bierens
Reviews.Content: We have a great time in this hotel.The service was good, every day clean room and towels. Special de kitchen manager Larry was very nice gay, hy bring us everywere. The people was very friendly and the sevice great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Andy0068
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in August 2011. I actually booked this hotel thinking it was in a different location. I found the reception staff very helpful especially as I needed a hire car and they put me in touch with Enterprise. My room had a card in it saying that room cleaning was only ever done every other day and not on weekends. This was not the case and it was done daily during the entire time of my stay. On one occasion when my room didnt really need tidying, they hung my suit and shirts up for me! I think the hotel has been refurbished in some areas and my room was on of the refurbished ones. The pool seemed well used by other guests. Breakfast however was dissappointing and I didnt believe it to be value for money but a short walk can be taken to either Hoolihans or McDonalds. Its ideal for Disney too as the 429 toll road is about 2 minutes away and within 10 minutes you can be in a Disney car park and avoiding the busy parts of the 192. A bit of a longer driver to Universal though. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Champions World and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Will continue to stay there again and again!”
Reviews.Author: chasnthsun
Reviews.Content: I live in Orlando and have stayed at this hotel several times before when family members come in from out of town. For the money, it is the best deal in town. The property is clean and a safe place to stay. My family members from out of state said that they would never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Sofi B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 3 weeks and it cost us very little. The location is extremely useful for those with their own method of transport but if you don't plan on hiring a car you can still get around if you plan your journeys. From the hotel you can get the Linx bus to Walt Disney World but you have to change twice..it is only $2 though so well worth it. Or the hotel runs free shuttle buses, 2 there in the morning and 3 returning at night. Often we would get the return service at night but make our own way there in the morning using the bus route as it gave us chance to stop at local shops on the way and get some lunch. The hotel is a 5 minute bus ride from Walmart and in the other direction a short drive to many restaurants, mini golf sites and shops. You can also walk from the hotel to local stores such as Dominos, Subway, Pizza Hut, McDonalds, local amenities and a chinese takeaway too. We had just stayed in the All Star Resort at Disney for a week and in comparison to this hotel we found the rooms were very similar. (Although the price was a lot lower at this hotel) This room offered an included microwave, fridge, built in safe and dining table. The rooms were very large for the two of us. We even had a larger tv here with additional channels. The reason this hotel doesn't get top marks is for a few reasons.. The hotel felt unsafe, it felt very like the motels you see on the American horror movies.. The pool was rather neglected; we never saw anyone in it. The hotel was very quiet with not many guests walking around and so felt a little discomforting. The view from our room was of a car park and busy road. The men who drove the shuttle services didn't speak very good English and so often we were unsure of where we were going and if we were on the right service. The maid would often knock on the door despite us requesting no room service. And finally the rooms felt a little unclean, we changed rooms on the 2nd day as ours smelt very strongly of tobacco. A cockroach even fell out of the air vent one night which made the place a little frightening to stay in for me. I wouldn't really recommend this hotel to families with children but if you have you're own car and you just want somewhere cheap to stay if you're visiting Disney or I-Drive then this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER COMING BACK!”
Reviews.Author: kcmyers13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, rundown, in definite need of remodeling and didn't allow a good portion of their amenities to be used. My stay was for a week and for 6 of the 7 days the workout room was closed or "out of order." This was not made known to me at check-in and there was no advertisement of it anywhere. There was also the outdoor pool and Jacuzzi under maintenance for over all but one day. When I asked for money back, the staff claimed these were free amenities and therefor, not entitled to a reimbursement. Needless to say there was mold in my bedroom, paint chipping everywhere, closed amenities that were promised and paid for by me without alternatives offered, and incredibly rude staff. I will NEVER be coming back and I hope you don't make the mistake of giving any money to this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MCookeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for July 25th - August 8th 2011. pulled up in our taxi and hotel looked lovely as it did in the lobby. our excitment came to a slight end when we were greeted by one rather officious lady on reception! she was rude and not helpful at all, and later on in our holiday seemed to be mocking and having a private joke about our english acscents!! our room was average but we were happy with it for the price that we has paid. there was two dounle beds in each room which we did find kind of strange. the air conditioning was amazing!!! on 24/7 pools were lovely, but only went into one as the other was more children based. we only had one problem with our room.... and this was the toliot, it broken about half way thru our holiday and had desided to no longer flush! once informing the staff a couple / 5 times it was finally looked at and they found out there was a plumming issue, after this we were quickly moved to another room, which was a small upgrade from our former room. the cleaning staff were brilliant at changing towels, making beds and cleaning up the horrible mess of clothes we left in the morning! this hotel is fine for the money you pay i wouldnt pay any more then this amount ! and i dont think i will be returning again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: wendy e
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort numerous times. There is an older section that they are working on, but the newer section is just great. Rooms have micro/fridge, clean. Nice lounge/bar area. There is a couple of pools so never really overcrowded. We work in the area and go stay there almost 3xs a month. You have to remember what you are paying for the room, it's not going to be the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Tossed up...”
Reviews.Author: luzsbrain
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel because I booked a pacakge thru JetBlue - which included air, car and hotel for a great price. We were also in the area for a convention so I was only staying 3 nights. Let me say we own a timeshare and are spoiled. When were not in timeshare we stay in suites. After reading all the 'bad' reviews from everyone I was nervous. Upon arrival, my husband was not happy, he said it looked like a sleazy hotel - but you cant judge by the outside right? The ladies at the front were very helpful and nice. They gave us a room on the second floor which I was not happy about since there was no elevator, but I dealt with it. Not that I require an elevator but we were attending a cash and carry show so we would have a lot of packages. She also said they had nothing else available. The building was behind the check in building we had a view of the pool. Some issues we had: The door was stuck it was a little tough to get it, the lighting in the room was really dark, the lamp and tv plugs were literately hanging out of the outlets and didnt appear safe, this building did not have an ice machine - we had to walk to another building, they charged a $3 per night resort fee, the bathroom door kept getting stuck, the A/C was very loud, we heard our neighbors, we heard when a truck would pass by, we heard the cleaning carts pass by, it was near an abandoned hotel, the charged for breakfast, the wireless was seriously slow. The good: There was a microwave and fridge, a sofa bed so you can fit 6 people, it was easy to find, the staff on Friday night was very nice and Monday morning was nice, my husband said the bed and pillows were comfortable enough. Its really hard to find any thing else,would I recommend? Perhaps for a night or two but other then that NO.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: scentman2004
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Our room had a couch and a refrigrator and Microwave. It slept 6 people. The room was very clean. The staff was very friendly. Everything worked. They have a very nice coverered pool.with hot tub. Plenty of Fast Food resturants and Walgreens close by. Disney a few miles away. The price they charge for the room, is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: landreu
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that my family and I have stayed in many hotels. For some good reason we always come back to the Champions World Resort. The staff are very professional, kind and loveable, the rooms extremely clean. Easy access to all shopping centers and attractions parks in Orlando area. We love the Heated pool and the 2 extra pools ,the game room for my son which is so important to a 8 year old!. I never had a probelm booking a room. The prices are incredible!!! We have recommend this Hotel to all our family and friends. Actually we have been booking a getaway weekend once a month. This Christmas we will be spending it at the Champion Workd Resort. Looking forward to that wonderful vacation. I love the Cahmpion world Resort hotel it has everything from a Refrigerator to microwave, to a laundry room and our favorite the Fitness center. Thank you Champion World Resort for making our family vacations so memorable.!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “for the price........perfect”
Reviews.Author: huntlarry3
Reviews.Content: first time here in the kissimmee area staying in a hotel,always stayed in i-drive orlando hotels.stayed for 4 days,clean,well kept rooms for the fair price i paid.front desk staff was nice and polite.had breakfast with family at there restaurant 3 times good food to get kids ready for 8 to 10 hours at disney. thanks for clean sheets and a good nights sleep......

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Motel not resort and Rude employees”
Reviews.Author: launika
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible the service stinks they promise one thing you get the next. The staff down talk the guest with other guest without even havin the curtacy to make sure that they where not part of the reunion. The bathrooms are nasty the beds are all stained up. they do nottttttttttttt use fitted sheets so when u move u end up touching that disgusting bed. Horrible Buffet breakfast 5 things onthe table oh and a few fruits i paid 20 for 2 people. mad ness. Dont do it. You get what you pay for honestly. noise and load people running all hours of the night i should have stayed at the one a few blocks down they have a theme park in the resort........
