Oh and my room door lokked like someone had already tried to break in the latch was cracked. ughhhh i can keep going and going.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel & rudest day manager”
Reviews.Author: Mo2233
Reviews.Content: Nothing that was promised was true. Our rooms were dirty, power was out, ice machines broken& dryers were broken. The worst part was the hateful, rude female day manager. The only nice thing was the housekeeping staff. Best part was when we all changed hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Motel/ Unsafe - if you stay here dont expect to get any sleep”
Reviews.Author: softballgirls
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this MOTEL with our daughters softball team. The entire team checked out 4 days early. Hotel staff, managers and security not willing to assist with disturbances all hours of the night from large groups. The rooms were small and dirty. Many did not have working air conditioners. Found bugs in the bathroom. For the price you pay here I would research other options and take all of these reviews seriously. You will be SORRY if you don't. There are no elevators and nobody there to assist carrying luggage up flights of stairs. I worked in the travel industry for 20 years , there is nothing resort about this place. It is NOT SAFE. I suspect anyone writing a favorable review is somehow associated with the MOTEL itself. A ZERO rating would be more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Back again for another stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mystery_Traveler_0
Reviews.Content: We have been back to Champions about 5 more times since the first review was posted and every time things were great!. This last trip we stayed in a different room near the pool with a sofa that tuned into a bed since we had another with us this trip. Room was nice with double sinks and new tile work the bathroom. The pool has had a fresh coat of paint and is looking good! The bathrooms look like they have had the tub/showers re-lined and there is new tile, looking good Champions! I would like to take a minute and talk about a unique feature of this hotel the fields outback. They have baseball fields and soccer / football area and courts, a nice feature when you are there with a team and could use a place to work out or you want to keep up your skills during a summer vacation. The grass on the soccer field was lush it felt like you were walking on a carpet, no holes and nice and level. A+ And for those of you who like to kick back with a magarita and some home made nachos you need to swing by the bar and get some of their awesome nachos! Even if you dont get the magarita get the nachos the kids were at Disney and talking about cant wait to get back and get some of those nachos again LOL Once again we have been back 5+ times since December and everytime has been great! A friend of ours suprised Dad with a trip down and now they are hooked also. This is a good place to stay with good prices a family oriented hotel. You can find fancier hotels but as far as value Champions is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “All Rooms are Dirty, Specially Beds”
Reviews.Author: usaleb
Reviews.Content: We stopped for two nights. We tried 6 different rooms !! We Left. Every single rooms in the hotel smells, humid, dirty disgusting carpets, and horrible bed sheets. There is no way in the world I would stay for the night. I went to their business center, and booked myself to another hotel immediately. I lost one night's reservation, but that's okay, I saved probably thousands of dollars and a lot of suffering from getting sick. People, your health will suffer, I am surprised to see how the health department doesn't look into hotels, common, this is a first world country, this is shameful and disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “dirtiest filthiest place.”
Reviews.Author: rmon02
Reviews.Content: Not even a resort, more like a crappy motel.during arrival on the corner of where my room is, is a wet dirty pair of underwear. Obviously not a usual sighting. Then I enter my room to pull open the sheets, ssuddenly ants scatter from exposure to the light. I enter my friends room and there is white powder on the tables. Still dont know what that was. Stains all over the floor and the lock on the door practically broken. Never bring your children here if u care about them..incredibly gross. I started looking for a new hotel as soon as I realized all of the disgusting attributes about this place.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kang009
Reviews.Content: clean hotel. friendly staff and a fun place for kids to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Filth and Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: MissM552011
Reviews.Content: We should have suspected something when we were greeted by an old broken toilet in front of our room when we arrived on that Friday. We asked management "Latisha" to have it removed. It was there when we left on Sunday. We walked in to the room and as soon as I removed my shoes I felt the carpet...it looked dirty and it was sticky. I immediately put on a pair of slippers and kept them on. Later during the trip I felt very itchy, I thought it was mosquitoes bites. Wrong! Wrong! Wrong! My finance' told me to look for small blood spots on the bedding. Not only did I find the spots, we also saw the HUGE bugs who had been feasting on my arms, back and face the night before while I was asleep. That's right BED BUGS!!! The pest control guy was called and he CONFIRMED IT!!!! BED BUGS. He looked behind the headboard and said "we are not going to disturb them!!! We were moved to another shabby room and prayed that we did not bring the creatures home with us!! Choose another place to spend your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!! STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!”
Reviews.Author: eternity4U
Reviews.Content: Our dates of stay was 6/18/2011 thru 6/23/2011. We arrived on June 18th and saw what a horrible place it looked from the outside we had concerns. However, we proceeded to check in. I stayed in the car why my husband went in, it seems that 30 or so more minutes passed and he wasn't back. Finally when he did make it back to the car he told me he was in there arguering with them because they said we didn't have a reservation for June 18th but showed one for June 22nd. So my husband mind you is from the islands and he can have a short fuse if someone continues to tell him something that is not true like WE DON'T HAVE A RESERVATION FOR YOU. Now mind you we didn't book on priceline, expedia or hotels.com we booked directly from there website. After my husband spent way to much time talking to clerk she went to get a reservation staff in the back that came and said WE DON'T HAVE A RESERVATION FOR YOU TO CHECK IN ON JUNE 18TH. Needless to say my husband in now asking for a manager, however, the manager will not be in till 6am tomorrow morning and we are here at 9pm at night. Well my husband gave her the confirmation numbers from there website and she said she couldn't pull that up.........WHAT?????? Ok my husband explaing to lady look we tired you need to go call for a manager because we have already paid and not paying twice. The reservation lady told my husband I'm going to prove to you there is no reservation, she went back and checked name and confirmation number again and guess what LOW AND BEHOLD, our reservation is there. The reservation lady proceeds to come back and tell my husband she found it with no apology or nothing. For all the time my husband spent talking to them he asked for an upgraded room with pool view, with microwave and refrigerator, due to all the problems reservations lady said done, no problem. When he gets back to the care I asked what was the problem and he began to explain. We finally get to our room, that was pool side, with microwave and refrigerator but low and behold once you walk in the room the SMELL IT WAS A VERY HORRIBLE MUSTY MUSTY MUSTY ODOR. Welll we walk in and say lets make the best out of this......There was two double beds with very old comforters, blankets and oh my gosh the sheets.......brown spots on them just GROSS!!!! We unpacked and went up the road to eat, got back to room showered, now the bathroom was ok........it was clean we had two sinks which helped out alot, however once we showered and got into bed we went to sleep this was day one at the so called resort. Day two Sunday morning June 19th I woke up scratching my legs constantly and I was trying to figure out what was going on since we bring our own shower get to shower with and our own lotion why are my legs itching I asked my husband he are you itching. Now I'm wondering what's going on. Days has turned to nights and the next morning woke up with bumps all over my legs..........BED BUGS BED BUGS BED BUGS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Oh my gosh it was horrible, I read some reviews that said the same thing.......but I'm here to tell you the BED BUGS ARE THERE!!! There's only two good comments for this MOTEL, they give you free WI FI and they had two sinks that's about it. So people stay here at your own Risk!!!! Remember if you decide to stay stop off at the Target that you are going to past and pick you up a large can of LYSOL and spray comforters, the raggedly blanks and sheets supposedly that smoothers bed bugs!!!! So to conclude I will never stay here again, due to the issues we had with checking in and with the bed bugs........We had to spray everything down before we left to go home, didn't want to bring in bed bugs to our house.

Reviews.Title: “Super Place”
Reviews.Author: mick1707
Reviews.Content: What a hidden Gem with all the hotels in orlando. This was a very pleasant surprise. Old hotel that's been remodeled, But the price and the service was every bit as nice as a 5 star that I've stayed in. Been down here for 3 months and every month where i was staying seamed to have its problems .So i look for a new place to stay. I got lucky here. Been here 3 weeks and can't find anything to complain about. AND THAT'S THE TEST OF A GREAT HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: dancemom62
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here from June 30th to July 8th. I was on the fence about booking here due to mixed reviews, however decided what the heck. Most hotels in Kissimmee are simply "2 beds, carpet and a bathroom", which was pretty much all we needed. When you come to this area, most people don't live in their hotel, and if you do you might as well just stay home. We had a poolside room on Block E, which was separate from the main part, which was fine with me. The pool and hot-tub were just a few feet from our door. They close both daily around 11:30 pm so noise was not an issue. The ice machine worked great and was just around the corner from our room. Our room was very clean and bright, even the carpeting..never had to worry about dirty feet the entire time, and had a fridge and microwave as I requested. The cable for the tv was not the best, but we weren't there to watch tv...and it is near impossible to get wifi. That really didn't bother me, cause I was with my teenage daughter and this was our last vacation before she leaves for University in september, so we had lots of quality time together... The beds were very comfortable and the rooms cleaned daily. This is the first hotel I have ever stayed in where the pillows were actually like real pillows...not just 1/2 stuffed, even fresh towels every day. Air conditioning worked excellent and looked like it was relatively new. Check in and out were a breeze. We came in late many nights, a couple around 3 am..and never once felt unsafe in the parking lot or the short walk to our room. We never used the restaurant or bar during our stay as we were out early every day. The location is great, lots of restaurants, shops and activities just down the strip. We never used the shuttle as we rented a car so we had the freedom to go wherever, when ever...so I cannot comment on that. We have stayed in some other well known chains, where the staff was rude and the rooms disgusting, and paid much more. Our experience here was nothing but positive, and I would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bed for the night... nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: iGareth
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable in terms of their prices. Room was clean, bedding changed almost every day. Bathroom was a nice size. Didn't use the pools but could have used the outdoor covered pool which is heated in the winter months. Hotel lobby was very nice, staff very helpful but it wouldn't have hurt them to smile once in a while.My only gripe was the bin men collecting every 2 days at 5.30am and were very loud with the dumpsters banging etc. Woke me up on every occasion, wouldn't have been a problem if we were facing the covered pool or were in a different block. Didn't use the hotel bar or restaurant but it was very close to the Olive Garden, Subway, Dominos and Cracker Barrel (plus others we didn't go to). Left turn into hotel can be a bit risky sometimes and can be difficult to see oncoming traffic - there is actually a filter arrow but I only seen it once in the whole stay... take care turning here!!! Would go here again if on a budget and wanting to stay in Kissimmee. This hotel is in a perfect location for Disney and if you travel 5min up the road and look left you can see the everest attraction in Animal Kingdom. The hotel offers free wifi which was flakey as best, wifi in the lobby was much much better and rock solid. Option to use two computers in reception with printer but they requirement payment for both internet access and printing. We often had the TV on in the room which had a terrible picture for many channels, not an essential item when on holidays but a minor criticism. On the plus side the maid service was exceptional! Please note that while this hotel has been refurbished and re-named they appear to be refurbishing many of the rooms - lots of paint tins and skips near one of the blocks which didn't appear to have any guests in.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you like to travel on the dark side.”
Reviews.Author: chrismonster8
Reviews.Content: This property was recommended by our miltary Tickets and Tours office (which I will be complaining loudly to when we arrive back home) and despite our fears after reading other reviews here, we went ahead and booked the room. Check-in was easy but the lobby is not a representation of the rest of the MOTEL. There is nothing RESORT about the facility. We (me, husband and toddler) spent as much time out of the room as possible due to smell, unsafe area and general dirtiness that we felt while in the room. The security consisted of two police cars being at the motel within 15 minutes of our check-in for unknown reasons. All the security disclaimers that we signed at check-in should have tipped us off to the safety of the area. We did not feel comfortable leaving anything of value in the room and would basically repack every morning. Bed linens were awful but there were plenty of pubic hairs included at no extra charge. Cable TV did not work but was promptly fixed after a call to the desk. at 11 pm. No such luck with the internet. Carpet was so filthy, I would not go without shoes or socks. Apparently the residents before us enjoyed Cheetos because many were left behind. The building that our room was house in was not part of the original property. In fact the front of our building had all the windows broken out and the back part of the building was deserted and very run down. The FREE SHUTTLE to Disney World is a joke. It runs only once a day and had so many conditions that no one could really take advantage of it. This place is considered a "friend of Disney World" but I truly believe that is something they just made up on their own because no one at Disney would EVER allow the Disney name to be connected to this shady, dump of a motel. The only good thing I can say about the place is that the beds were made daily. And always with the free pubic hairs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! We won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: Tobi87
Reviews.Content: We "won" a promotional trip through Casablanca Express, who gave us the option of staying at the Travelodge in downtown Orlando, or "upgrading" to Champions World Resort. So we paid a small fee to "upgrade"... and I think the Travelodge would have been more bang for our buck. The pictures on the internet were more than deceiving. From the moment we checked in, the front desk staff was unprofessional, unfriendly and unhelpful. We had to ring a bell, then wait several minutes for someone to come to the desk from a back room, and she had been eating and still had food in her mouth when she walked up to the desk. Our room was on the back side of the property, and I was scared to even go out to my car without my husband, as the parking lot was poorly lit and was run down. The doorframe to our room was bent and looked like someone had tried to break in before. The TV was fuzzy with very poor reception and had only a few channels. There was hair in the shower and the ceiling tiles were crumbling. The carpet was dirty and the room overall looked dingy with few lights that worked. I have stayed in Motel 6's that were nicer and where I felt safer. The ice machines did not work, and the wi-fi would only work when sitting in the front lobby. The pools and hot tub were about the only enjoyable part of our stay. Needless to say, we spent as little time as possible in the room and a lot of time touring the area! We were very dissatisfied and disappointed, and will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “First time here and would return”
Reviews.Author: Rolandgrassick
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 2 weeks at champions resort. Not fancy at all but better than ur average cheap stay-over by a mile!!! In room 604 and it was quiet & clean. Just what u want to come back to after park days and such. Our housekeeper lady was lovely, always there to clean our room! Worth her weight in gold! If ur looking for great location and value for money then this place is the answer! Back in sunny scotland today so depression is setting in!! P.s. Florida people are the best!! Love the place...

Reviews.Title: “Good Bday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: melz624
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Champions World Resort when we visit Orlando. This weekend proves why we always come back. Staff is friendly and willing to help. Special thank you to Latisha for making our stay and my birthday weekend special. Rooms are always clean and beds are comfy. Can't wait until our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler Beware”
Reviews.Author: Loutrenda
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation based on the mixed hotel reviews. The moment I arrived for check-in the regrets began. To make a long story short....what you see on the internet is not a reality. The room we were given was in the very back of the property in an almost remote location. Only one light in the room out of 5 was working; when you plugged in the lamp the TV went off; none of the ice machines worked (I was told to come to the front desk to get ice from the bar). Maintenance was called four rime and never showed up. This was an aweful experience. Please make reservations elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good price... but we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: mommydeanto3
Reviews.Content: Booked here on the fly, was not expecting a 4 star hotel for the rate, but got less than I was expecting. First of all the positives...rate was very reasonable and the location was excellent for getting to Disney. The housekeeping did really well as far as making the beds daily and supplying plenty of towels and soap. The pools were clean as far as we could see. Now for the negatives...the carpet was filthy, after walking on it for only 5 seconds our socks were black on the bottom. While not here to watch TV it does get used late in the evening or early in the morning. The reception was terrible and there are limited channels. We washed and dryed clothes once during our stay and the laundry facility is nasty, not maintained at all. Also there was no ice machine as stated on the property map. And last but not least, it appeared that the "resort" was being used as a residence for a numerous amount of low income individuals. In the end we decided to leave a night early and not stay in this so called resort.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT FIVE STAR SERVICE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: lancslads
Reviews.Content: We have just had our 6th stay at Champions World Resort in Kissimmee, Florida for 2 weeks in June 2011. Everything was excellent yet again, reception staff, housekeeping staff, maintenance and management, staff , all three swimming pools, comfort of rooms, hotel bar and restaurant, cleanliness of all the hotel and rooms were all first class, nothing is too much trouble for the staff, again the rooms are cleaned daily, we had a poolside room complete with microwave, fridge, coffee machine, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, TV and two massive comfortable beds. we would definately reccomend a stay at Champions World Resort,

Reviews.Title: “Most Bang for the Buck.”
Reviews.Author: Joel33773
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this property, I felt I needed to write my own personal experience of this property. I found the room very clean and comfortable. The Frig/Microwave was spotless and worked very well. The mattresses were firm and not well worn at all. I really enjoyed the outside covered pool. It was clean and not slimy at all, as I read in a previous review. The staff at the front desk were nice for the most part. The only problem I had was with the internet. At first they tried to blame my computer, but when I changed room, it worked fine. Please replace some of your routers that are not working, people at Champions. They only cost about $30 each now and easy to install. Looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I WILL NEVER EVER STAY AT THIS DUMP AGAIN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: minnesota20111961
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here, and we were not satisfied at all!! The room was dirty, the front desk service was poor, very unfriendly! The shower had hair in it. There was no pressure in the shower!! I was very dissapointed! They charge for everything even local calls!

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hampton926
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous to stay here because the price was so low, but we were pleasantly surprised! The staff was very helpful, the rooms were clean, and they have three pools and a jacuzzi, so you don't have to worry about them being overcrowded. They have a nice game room and sports fields out back for the kids and the bar onsite is great. The bartender and the patrons give it a "cheers" atmosphere and the prices are unbeatable and the food is great:) I would definitely recommend staying here again and we can't wait to go back! You WILL NOT find another hotel 1/2 as nice as this for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place. Good location. Bad Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Bonzermoon34
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to write this review at first because I know the repercussion a business faces as result of negative reviews. However, I think that in this case, it is important for people considering a stay at Champions to read this. I arrived at Champions at 12:30 hoping for an early check in. The Agent informed that I would not be able to check in since there were no rooms available and it was before the scheduled check-in time. I informed him that I would have to cancel the reservation and go elsewhere as I was sure there were hotels with vacancy nearby that would appreciate my business. He then immediately gave me a room key. So, I was of course happy to be checking in 2 hours early, but I was also left with a sour taste that this man lied to my face. I then brought my luggage to the room, turned down the thermostat since it read 79, and went to explore the property. The grounds were very nice. Everything was clean, and the pool area was inviting. Upon return to my room, things went a bit downhill. I turned on the light in the bathroom and found 2 cockroaches in the tub. Then I checked the thermostat, and even though I turned it down, it now read 80 degrees. I gave it another 20 minutes to see if it would cool down, and it didn't. Oddly enough, I didn't hear or feel any air coming out of the vent. At that point I had enough. I told the front desk agent I'd like a refund. She asked me why. I told her the air conditioning wasn't working and they had bugs in the room. She offered to get the room looked at. I said no thank you, I'll be going elsewhere. Since it was a 3 night stay, I would expect a full refund for all 3 nights. She only offered a refund for 2 nights. A refund that I have not seen post to my account, even though it has been 6 days. Obviously I find it offensive that this place wants me to pay them when they initially lied to me, gave me a room with cockroaches, and a non working a/c unit. I afforded them the opportunity to make things right, but now that it has been a week and I still haven't seen any refund, I find in necessary to let others know what kind of a business they run. It's really too bad, because I liked the property, the rooms look nice, and the location is great. Oh well, I found a much better place down the street that knows how to treat its customers for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Smelly, Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: NvmbrQueen
Reviews.Content: The property itself was dirty. There were holes on the floor, the laundry area was disgusting. The ice machine near our room was out of service, so my husband had to walk far to get ice. Our room smelled like cigarette smoke! We called the front desk and were told that all rooms were nonsmoking. We asked for housekeeping to bring some air freshener, but nobody showed up. The carpets were extremely filthy. When we went to the covered pool, it was dirty and full of slime. I couldn’t even go in because I was afraid I would catch a rash. Since we got there late, we didn’t have a chance to cancel and go elsewhere. This was the first and last time I ever stay in this dump. Please stay away unless you want to get sick and be grossed out by this awful place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: fendergrl89
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through Bookit.com. When we visited the resort's website, the images showed a nice clean room, well put together, including refrigerator, microwave, and hot water and pools. When we arrived to Florida from our 21 hour drive, we were exhausted and ready to get some rest finally! When we walked into the room, not only did we notice a bad odor, we also noticed the lighting was terrible. The bathroom lights flickered and weren't bright enough. There was no water pressure coming out of the bathroom sink, and the shower completely did not throw water at all! The rug was filthy and didn't look like it was vacumed in weeks! I found hair in the bathroom towels. The bed sheets were stained and the sofa bed was disgusting! The microwave didn't work, and the refrigerator was blowing hot air instead of cold! And not to mention the pools looked filthy! I have nothing nice to say about this location, or the service provided. We immediately went back downstairs to ask for a refund, and we booked at the Hampton a little down the street instead!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: candy040
Reviews.Content: We had a one week stay at Champions world and enjoyed our stay very much. The resort was clean large rooms with fridge and microwave. Nice covered out door pool and the rooms were very clean. We enjoyed it so much we have a two week stay reserved in Aug.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jstmelkng
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, however, the staff is very receptive, helpful and show that they take pride in their work and the satisfaction of their customers. Beds are new and comfortable. The rooms are clean. I have already reserved for my next stay in June.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean rooms, simple but nice, draws an unfortunate clientele”
Reviews.Author: Calliou
Reviews.Content: We were looking for inexpensive lodging while visiting Disney Parks and found it here. The staff was great, the room was clean, towels were nice... Daily cleaning service. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Beds didn't "creak" which was nice since I got up a few times at night with my 14 month old while my husband and older son slept in the same room. Air conditioning was loud! Everything about the hotel was good (not fancy, but clean). The only downside was since this is a budget hotel it draws a different standard of people... kind of rough crowd, which is not our style. We had guests above us and out at the pool that were screaming and yelling until late at night. They were having fun in the pool without any regard to other guests sleeping. I did call the front desk at 10pm since it was so loud I couldn't even sleep with earplugs. They sent security over right away and the noise by the pool died down shortly thereafter. At 12 o'clock at night I could still hear the people above us banging around while I had earplugs in, but I didn't call security for that. The next day I asked the front desk if the guests above us had checked out (and luckily they had!!!) or I would have asked to switch rooms our second night. The pool outside was very pleasant, the indoor pool temp was like a hot tub (well, not quite, but pretty darn hot for a pool). I might consider staying here again if the price was the deciding factor, but based on the clientele we would probably opt for a higher grade place for more money with the hopes that the clientele would be of a higher standard too :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: LITravelBug
Reviews.Content: we had to rush down to florida for a family emergency and we stayed here for a couple of nights. the accomodations were good.....everything you need to get the day going. Nothing fancy, but practical. The pools looked inviting, but we were too busy to swim. It's a good deal for the price and yes, it is close to all the Disney attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CplClot
Reviews.Content: On arriving at this hotel, my heart sank as it looked shabby. However on checking in the staff were extremely helpful and were more than happy to change our room from a ground floor accommodation to a 1st floor one with no fuss. Our rooms were cleaned every day and all bed linen and towels were changed daily. The pool area outside our room was clean and well kept and the spa pool was an added bonus. This hotel is local to Disney parks and is about 20 minutes drive from universal and sea world parks. There are lots of restaurants nearby, and of course all that Kissimmee has to offer is on your doorstep. I would recommend that a visit to the nearby super target supermarket should be made early on as it has many many bargains and is on par with Costco in the uk. All in all we enjoyed our stay here @ champions world resort - it was clean, secure and each room has it's own electronic safe to store valuables securely. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great !!!”
Reviews.Author: Cintia74
Reviews.Content: That was my 4 time at the Champion World Resort. Perfect hotel. Near of everything. Clean. Very nice breakfeast. Service just perfect. Very nice people. I'm coming back this season.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: dtrouble83
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Orlando 4yrs ago at a 5 star resort. I received the same respect at Champions as I did at there. Just the front end was not very informational on the amenities. I was unaware of the restaurant until our son came down and stopped at the bar. My suggestion are that they should put a flyer about the restaurant and bar in the room. I was unaware of the breakfast. The maintance was very helpful in finding information about the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Its cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: BBonholls
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to our room, I was slightly worried as we were in the seperate block across the carpark. Our room opened straight into the carpark area, which some teenagers were loitering in when we arrived. Every time anybody pulls up in the carpark, we could hear it, anytime anybody walks past talking, we could hear it, loud and clear. The room was very basic, good size fridge, microwave. The bed was very comfortable, and the TV had a good selection of channels. The bathroom looked quite dirty, stains on the bottom of the bath, filthy sink and plugs etc. But we were there to spend our days at disney, and it was a cheap hotel, so weren't too fussed. Halfway through our holiday, we were awoken at 2am by a man being arrested directly outside our room. We ended up being evacuated from our rooms due to their being a 'meth lab' 2 doors down, and were not able to return till 8.30am. (Search Champions world resort drugs on google etc.) We also noticed that a room across the carpark had its window smashed which wasn't a great sight. The hotel is on the bus route if you decide to use the LYNX buses, as the free hotel transfer was too overcrowded and not often enough. a daypass is $4.50 for the bus, and the bus drivers are all willing to help you find your way. As we checked out on the last day we were faced with a $159 phone bill, however we only made 2 complete calls. We were told that if it rings 3 times it will charge you, however there was a call on the bill that only 4 numbers had been dialed, (so it couldn't have rang) and we had been charged $14.40. The manager reluctantly removed it from the bill. SO I would advise against using the hotel phone. The hotel has 2 swimming pools and a hot tub, which we used one day, and did enjoy. Overall, the hotel isn't great, but I guess you get what you pay for, and we didn't pay much. Hope I haven't worried any one too much, I can see from other reviews that other people have great experiences of this hotel, me and my partner may have just been unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN & FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: disneyfriends
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying here and enjoy each time better. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean with microwave and small refrigerator, such a convenience. It was quiet and restful.

Reviews.Title: “Demolish this Junker!”
Reviews.Author: llsmith3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Orlando for a wedding and an extended relaxing trip...it was a hassel thanks to Champions World resort. We booked through BookIt.com a King Suite non smoking unit in a 5 star hotel.... YEA RIGHT! We got there and found they do not have any king suites...the place was a dump...there was trash all over our room... and not to mention we got to the hotel at midnight so it was near impossible to change hotels...we went to Walgreens and bought lysol! The hotel staff acted as though I was so out of line for wanting a refund and to remove the remaining nights that we booked... they charged us for two nights due to (get this) late cancellation!!!!! This was absolutely horrible... thank God we did not have our children with us on this trip or we would have slept in our car!

Reviews.Title: “Once a Horror, Now a Dream”
Reviews.Author: ThaHeaths
Reviews.Content: The first time that we stayed at this resort, it was a Ho-Jo. The online pictures made the place seem to be a nice place to stay at. Once we got there however, it looked more like Mogadishu. We had a horrible time! This time that we stayed, we had no idea that the Ho-Jo was now Champions. When we pulled into the parking lot, I started laughing because we had booked the same place as last time! However, the stay this time was the difference between night and day. The staff was very professional and courteous. The only problem that we had was that our TV remote's batteries were bad and couldn't get them replaced. But other than that, a most pleasant experience. We are planning to return there for our anniversary in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: casdj
Reviews.Content: Is a nice hotel with many amenities, room service was excellent. The shuttle was not so confy, because run for 3 hotels, but Champions is the first so you can have a seat haha. If you have a car, fine, because if you don't have a car you don't have many alternatives to eat. I like this hotel and really recomend it. This hotel is near to a Chinese buffett, Dominos Pizza, Pizza Hut, Walgreens, McDonalds...

Reviews.Title: “Sleep, Swim, and enjoy the atmosphere but make sure you eat out!”
Reviews.Author: mrhughes325
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great to sleep and lay in the sun at. They have a great heated pool. Their front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Their gift shop is a great convienance store and sells discount tickets. Make sure to have the lovely michael help you with your theme park planning he is brilliant. They have beautiful grounds that are almost complete in the back dedicated to the sports minded. The only upsetting thing was the restaurant. The staff not only seemed like they had no experience but they wore jeans and t-shirts and gold chains. I would never expect to go stay at a resort and feel like i was in a hill-billie bar. The food was ok however. It would have been nice to have a real breakfast buffet though. When we checked out Elly was very sweet. I would definately come back and stay here, i will just go out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth what we paid!”
Reviews.Author: jjzmgailey
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical about making a reservation here with the rates as low as they were, knowing that you get what you pay for. I decided to go for it since 5 of the 7 reviews I read were here were good. We had reservations for 4 nights. We weren't able to make it our first night due to work circumstances and the staff was very understanding about it and put a note in our reservation that we would be checking in the following day. We didn't get a credit for that night, but I absolutely wouldn't expect any resort to do that with such short notice. Anyway, we requested a room by the pool when we made our reservation and ended up by their second pool...it was great because the pool was literally right outside our door. It was sort of odd because it almost felt like we were in an entirely different hotel from where we checked in, but it was just fine. The thing is, when you stay here, you cannot go there expecting it to be a 5-star resort, because it is not. You cannot expect to get shown to your room or to have someone help with your luggage. If you want that kind of service, you're going to have to pay more than what they charge here. The room had 2 double beds and there was lots of floor space...very roomy. The toilet and bathtub were separate from the sink/mirror so someone could still be getting ready while another person was in the shower. Lots of space to hang clothes too. I was also VERY impressed with their quality of towels, nice and thick! That may seem funny to some of you, but I've stayed at "value" resorts before where the towels are so thin that I've been tempted to go buy new ones! It was a real easy drive to Walt Disney World property, usually took about 1/2 an hour with traffic. Lots of restaurants and stores on the way. If you're looking for an inexpensive, clean and comfortable place to sleep and shower, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “What I think”
Reviews.Author: sabrinabrewer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 04/24 to04/28 the rooms were clean had no problem with that. I had a pet, and because of that we were put in the last building where there was NO ICE machine I Had to walk forever to get Ice. It was like we were in another world I wanted a room around the pool but I couldn't have it. they are pet friendly but not friendly to the people with the pet. I. didn't want maid service so ask for just towels but they were never brought. I felt like I wasn't part of the resort it's self because of my pet. I had to give my credit card to have the phone turned on, but they could call my room to get me to go on a time share tour. I will NEVER stay here again. If you have a pet and would like to be treated like a outcast this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest places to stay.”
Reviews.Author: humbirds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last yr and loved the room. The people were very nice and helpful also. Very close to Disney and City Walk. Am returning to stay again this yr for vaca. Can't wait. Oh yea, The Breakfast was wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: ange_trouble
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY! I have never seen a hotel so poorly taken care of! We had booked a room here as part of a hotel/flight deal and if I had of known what I was walking into I would of booked elsewhere! Our flight go into Orlando late on April 12 so by the time we arrived at Champions it was 11:30pm we got to our room and all you could smell was mold! There was what appeared to be blood on the wall & the sheets, the bathroom light was flickering. So we went to the front desk to complain, they switched our room. The next room was musty smelling but not moldy & and the sheets were clean so as it was so late we went to bed, knowing we would find something else in the morning. We had paid extra for sofa bed, let me tell you that sofa was not fit for anyone to sleep on! It was DIRTY! I've seen sofas sitting on the side of the road that were cleaner! We tried to shower in the morning and there was no hot water & half way through my shower the water stopped all together! We adressed the front desk about the problems with the room and they acted like they had no idea what we were talking about. This place is gross and I would NEVER recommend this to anyone. One night there was more than enough for me!

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rebeccah6
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend were travelling to orlando for 2 weeks to visit disney and universal theme parks (5th-19th april 2011) booking: didn't recieve a confirmation, which made me nervous. we wanted to enquire about theme park shuttles so we rang and got passed through to various people before getting told that the information constantly changed and we were not able to have any information on times/services. check in: quick but unfriendly. we were given a huge map of the hotel with our room number circled. no directions given really, and nobody to show us to our rooms or help us with our suitcases. we spent 15 minutes trailing the hotel grounds in the cold early hours trying to find our room. this was very frustrating, but we eventually found it. a little more help would have been good here. room: clean. nothing broken/wrong with the room. 2 double beds, reasonably comfortable, and very clean. out dated tv with cable channels (they were ok). air conditioning worked well but often got turned off by cleaners whilst we were at the parks, leaving us to come home to a warm room. bathroom was clean with large mirror. The shower and sink water would only come out scorching towards the end of our holiday (please beware of this with children, the water was boiling temperature, it burnt the colour off of the sponge that was hung in the shower. after 10 minutes of trying, if we were lucky we would get a cold water coming out. this was the same with the sink, therefore we could not refill our water bottles which was annoying. there is a microwave and fridge in the room which was useful. i cannot comment on the restuarant/gym/pools as we did not use any of these. but the covered pool always looked busy so im guessing it was OK! although we looked at the restaurant menu one night and it looked very limited. shuttle services to the parks were always prompt, friendly, helpful. they pick up at 3 more hotels though, so can get really crowded and hot. but they're free, so can't complain. information available in reception for parks/buses/directions is helpful, can find all park maps and stuff there. Most reception staff were helpful, but there were a few unfriendly, snappy ones. one day when our room card key wouldnt work and we needed to get our bags before getting on the park shuttle we were asked 'why we needed to go back to our room' 'what our bags were for, why we needed them'. this was annoying, as we only had 2 minutes before the shuttle left and were facing an inquision! Across the road there is a chinese buffet (walked in then out, food looked greasy) there is also a dominos and pizza hut, pharmacy and a chinese takeaway. we made use of the dominos and pizza hut most nights! ok, so the one HUGE problem we had throughout our stay was with the phone in the room. In the room above us, we had an hotel employee named Michael. the phone lines had 'somehow' been crossed and we recieved a call one morning (6am!) asking for michael. we simply thought this was a guest who had rung our room by mistake and forgot about it and went back to sleep. we recieved these calls every morning for the last 5 days of our stay. they were at 6am, 7am, 8am, sometimes 3 in one morning. after complaining over the phone, telling them they'd got the wrong room, and then officially complaining to the reception who apologised and said they'd fix it, THEY CONTINUED! we even got messages left on the phone for Michael, from other employees, talking rudely about other guests at the hotel! not nice! two days before we left, the phone rung, as usual at 6am asking for michael, i was so mad and frustrated at being woken up AGAIN, that i shouted at them and told them that this was not his room and that i was very 'pissed off'. i guess then, they got off their arses and knocked on his door if they wanted him, as on our last day they didnt ring (yay.) the only other complaint was, it was my boyfriends birthday during our stay and i asked at reception where i could purchase a cake (this was my first time in orlando) i was told the restaurant could help me out. the restaurant manager wasnt there, i was asked to write a note and put it in an envelope and it would be given to him. i got no reply, no cake. obviously not bothered about enhancing their guests stay. check out was: 'were checking out' .. 'ok, your bill is..' they didnt ask if we had enjoyed our stay, if we'd had a good time ect.. overall, good cheap base for visiting theme parks, but i did not recieve any exceptional customer service here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Soregood
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews we were not sure about staying here. We were pleasently suprised at what we found. Yes itis an older resort but everything we kept in nice repair and very clean. Upon arrivel we asked to see the room before checking in. Joann at the front deksk was happy to allow us this and we saw a room that was spacious and very clean. Even under the beds and behind the toilets it was clean. We got checked in with Joann making sure we had everything we needed by way of directions around the are and the locations of different amenaties at the resort. Later that night coming in from dinner we had a flying bug come in with us. Being a room of chicken women we called down to the front deck to see if anyone could come get it for us. Within minutes Miguel with maintenance was there to help us. While he was there, he asked if everything was fine with the room or if we needed anything else. On another day of our stay while we were relaxing housekeeping came and cleaned the room. Again asking if there was anything we needed extra or had concerns about when she was done. Latisha at the front desk also was a joy to interact with. We received the same service from this staff if not better then we have had while staying on Disney property. This is now our place to stay when we visit Disney which we do every 6 weeks or so.

Reviews.Title: “discusting”
Reviews.Author: shadae08
Reviews.Content: the rooms was full of cobweab and the bathroom was dirty,we had to move to the best western hotel which was fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms. You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: NYToTampaGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early April while attending a softball tournament. I am a hotel snob so I was a little freaked out upon hearing we'd be staying at this hotel. Upon arrival, my room was fairly clean. There was an unfortunate odor that lingered during our stay but nothing unbearable. The rooms are extremely outdated as is the TV. Had a minor issue with something on one of the blankets but maintenance was quick to bring up a replacement. For the price, it was a decent room. If you're used to staying at the Hiton or Marriott, don't stay here. If you want a clean room for a decent price, this is the place for you. The continental breakfast was very weak but there is a Waffle House right in the parking lot. I wouldn't have chosen this hotel on my own and would stay somewhere else when visiting Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value”
Reviews.Author: aprilb73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OUTSTANDING value!!! The staff was incredible from Ralph the maintenance man, to the guest services person, to the wait staff at the bar, to the maids and front desk people. Everyone went above and beyond. The rooms were large and clean! I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price Clean And No Bed Bugs !”
Reviews.Author: travelalot0420011
Reviews.Content: My Girlfreind and I recently Stayed At Champions World Resort from end of march to the beginning of april. . We Booked For 4 night's. We were used to staying at 4 or 5 star hotels so we gave this one a try. The room was clean with our first inspection. We removed the headboard to inspect for bed bugs and under the mattress None ! The bathroom was clean and so was the rest of room. The room was cleaned every day around 11am. All of our things were secure and safe. The dirve to the airport was maybee a half an hour, on the toll road to west irlo bronson. The drive to universal was about 20 mins give or take. From the hotel to Cape canaveral was about an hour. There are 2 pizza places that deliver to the room which you can see from across the street pizza hut and dominoes. seven eleven and walgreens are close under a mile away. Cant speak for the Pool didnt go swimming but the pool had alot of people in it at all hours. The only thing I can say that I didnt like was walls were thin. If you stand in bathroom you can hear the people in the next room. The last thing I didnt like was the complimentry computer in the lobby charged for internet use per minute ! I did not use there computer but wanted to, just to print a boarding pass. This is the only hotel Ive been to that has done that. I have satyed at alot. Other than those 2 things the room was what it was a room. Fridge microwave bed ect. Clean and cheap .

Reviews.Title: “We thought we turning into fish because we spent so much time in the heated pool.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa15473
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable with wifi, microwave, refrig. Heated pool was wonderful ! Restaurant was slow but had pretty good food. Location was great, with restaurants and parks close by. We could walk across the highway to a wonderful small church, The Roots Community Church. We stayed for 2 weeks. You can't beat this hotel for the price. It will be interesting to see this hotel as their planned improvements come about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Disney Parks Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyRio
Reviews.Content: All we needed was a place to sleep while we spent all day/night in the parks. For the value we got much more. Nice to have free parking with surveillance and live security. The resort is less than 3 miles from the entrances to the parks. I like the large rooms. Very clean. The convienance of the microwave & 3 foot fridge was a plus. . I was able to shop at the grocery store and store our food in one trip! Kids loved the warm water in the pool. This place is RIGHT ON for value and friendliness. If you have a large group- get the adjoining rooms to make it even better.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shelley_lynn_11
Reviews.Content: I NEVER write reviews after staying in hotels, but I thought I REALLY need to get the word out to all of you and warn you about this "hotel" To start, when we got there, we had confirmation on paper for 2 rooms, and apparently they lost the reservation for the 2nd room so had to try and find us another room. The room was FILTHY. I don't even think the shower was cleaned for numerous months because the soap scum was very thick on the walls. I opened up the drawer with the BIBLE and found half of a condom wrapper. The tv only had maybe 20 channels...IF THAT, and half the time the picture would go all weird. BTW- if you go here, dont think you are going to get any ice because not 1 single ice machine worked. Oh and the first rooms we were in, no wifi- too far away to even pick it up... While we were there, my friend and I were gone out for the day and while we were out I guess a pipe broke around our rooms. So my friend's mom and dad were told they needed to re locate to different rooms (ok, so i understand these things happens, but wait...it gets worse)... so her parents had to pack up their stuff and our stuff. They requested 2 rooms to be on the bottom floor as her mom has arthritis and has trouble with stairs but was told they only had rooms on the top floor. They then had to cart up their suitcases AND our suitcases to another building and up a flight of stairs-- and not ONE SINGLE PERSON offered to take the luggage to another room for them. Instead, the maid was complaining of how much work this is going to make for her, as if she didnt have enough work as it was......well, sorry that its an inconvenience to you and not to us. Customer Service--- I dont even think they know the meaning of the words "Customer Service". I did not encounter 1 single nice person that worked there. They were all very rude, and not helpful at all. And we even had 1 woman at the front desk roll her eyes after we asked her to make sure our room got cleaned because we had the "do not disturb" sign on for 4 days, so just wanted to make sure it would get cleaned. And when we checked out, all we got was a "ok, you're all set"..... no normal "thank you for staying at our hotel, come back soon" or anything like that....like a normal hotel would do. OVERALL- Please, please, please take my advice, and NOT GO HERE!...... I realize I didnt pay a whole lot for this place, but I would have gladly paid a little extra money to stay at a place that appreciated us as guests and had clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Champions has numerous offerings, clean hotel rooms, and good service for unbeatable rates! Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Skmoore4
Reviews.Content: Being used to staying in a timeshare/condo type unit in the Kissimmee area I was a little leary about a stay at a traditional hotel/motel type unit with what seemed like a really low room rate for the area. From the moment I Entered the lobby of champions at check in until the time I left I was very impressed with the rooms, amenities, and customer service of the staff. I was very impressed with all champions had to offer from the business center, buffet style restaurant/bar, two pools (one heated), laundry facilities, work out room, grill/picnic area, and rooms which were well maintained. Also, having well maintained soccer fields, softball/baseball fields, and basketball courts is I'm sure a definite plus for traveling sports teams. I was very satisfied with my week there and enjoyed the proximity to restaurants, shopping areas, and Disney parks. The one and only thing I would change would be increase the amount of complimentary shuttle runs to Disney parks

Reviews.Title: “This place is not how they advertised”
Reviews.Author: kingboyz23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this restore with my children and the service and room quality was very bad. Before getting there I asked to have a fridge and microwave in my room I had to call the front desk twice before they did anything about it. Their was a hole in the bathroom wall their was no TV remote in the room the safe did not work and service took forever,if they came at all. Their was no need to complain ,because management did nothing about it besides give us $2.00 in tokens to their arcade for our problems. They rated themselves as a 3 star hotel and the manager tells my wife they are only a 2 star ,but at best they are a 1. I would not recommend this hotel ,because it is not worth the money or time. Do not book this hotel based on the pictures ,because they are very decieving.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: CookieBear83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we made our first trip to Disney World, we absolutely loved the place. Our room was newly renovated economy room and was very very clean. I did not have to worry about my children picking up some sort of fungus or warts because the carpet was nice, the showers were clean and the hotel staff had made a bouquet of flowers using the wash clothes, which I thought was very cool. We had received fresh linen daily. We did not swim in the pool or get into the hot tub because it was January and the weather was very cold, however the landscaping around the hotel is gorgeous and very unique. We recommend this place to all of our friends. If you want a worry free, affordable vacation spot you should check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you'll be gone most of the day”
Reviews.Author: FL0RABEL
Reviews.Content: PROS:+innexpensive +near restaurants, gift shops, etc + actual HEATED pool-warm and great for march weather, other places say heated but this one WAS +more than one pool + cute playground CONS: -sofa was dirty, sink was clogged, tub was dirty -many people loud and yelling at night -I'd only stay here if I was going to be away at the parks or at the pool and not actually in the rooms, didn't like the rooms at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sdharps
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about this hotel. Once I arrived my fears subsided. The room was clean and comfy. The bathroom was outdated but clean. The lobby was very well kept. The grounds when I was there in May 2010 were not well kept. The pool was not murky and the area my room was located in was unsafe at night. We only used the room for sleeping, so it was perfect for my needs! The great perk was the free shuttle!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is like family!”
Reviews.Author: AnotefromSJ
Reviews.Content: I had a lovey stay. The resort is a value, and taking the back road on Sherberth, I traveled to Disney in 6 minutes. The staff is warm and attentive. I felt like I was at home with family.

Reviews.Title: “It's all good =)”
Reviews.Author: Vaca2011
Reviews.Content: A great place for Disney & theme parks! When I booked this hotel on their website I knew I was beggining my Disney vacation by saving money on a clean, friendly hotel in a great location. I also realized I would have to pay for other expenses to keep up any OTHER expenses for my trip including morning coffee. The only complimentary ammenity at this hotel is the internet and it is based on availability- ( if it is ON it is available- if not-then it will return when its back up and running- it is simply complimentary and should not be relied upon) The resort does offer a nice clean heated pool, and a play area for kids & there is dining and a bar available as well. The housekeeping was thorough to keep things clean and the rooms have refrigerators and microwaves for convienance at no charge and they even brought a baby crib complimentary/no charge. This is a great place for the price !

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I know it's cheap, but....”
Reviews.Author: Micah214
Reviews.Content: Ok, I realize this is a budget hotel, but I wish they would spend a little money and spruce up the place. We had a room in the building that used to be some other hotel next door to the main property. The safety door latch was broke. The cord on the hair dryer had a cut in it and it was still plugged in. None of the outlets would hold a plug because they were so worn out. The plug would just fall right out! It would help if the walls were wiped down once in a while and a little bleach and elbow grease on the bathroom floor would go a long way. Take showers at night because in the morning there's not any hot water. Served it's purpose for a couple of nights but I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family friendly home from home”
Reviews.Author: nicspiggybank
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 week stay at the Champions World Resort. Just before we went I read a couple of bad reviews on Tripadvisor and was considering changing our booking to another hotel. I am so glad that we didn't - our room was immaculately clean and newly decorated, with two really comfy double beds, a bathroom with bath and shower, microwave, fridge, iron, hairdryer, coffee maker, free safe and free wireless internet service. The hotel has several pools but we mainly used the covered pool, which was beautifully clean, as warm as a bath, open until 11pm and a good way to relax after a hectic day at Disney. The hotel has a bar and restaurant. The bar is kid friendly and has events most nights (live music, quiz, karaoke etc.) it also serves food (including a kids menu) until 10pm, which is handy when returning from Disney late in the evening. They are not expensive and have special drinks promotions. The staff are lovely and really made a fuss of my 7 year old daughter. The restaurant also serves breakfast - you can choose from a continental through to a full buffet style - we ate there a few times. Within 5 minutes walking distance of the hotel there is a lovely Italian restaurant called Brunos (also has a great kids menu), a buffet style chinese restaurant, Subway, Dominos Pizzas, Pizza Hut, McDonalds and a Seven Eleven shop. The hotel runs a free shuttle service to the Disney Transportation Centre (where you can pick up a free Disney shuttle to all their parks), to Seaworld and to Universal Studios/Islands. While we were there in February the shuttle ran to Disney at 9.55am and returned at 5.45pm, 8.45pm and 10.15pm. To Seaworld and Universal was 7.30am returning at 7.30pm. This was great for us but I'd imagine that in the summer they would run additional services. There are also public bus stops right outside the hotel for the Lynx public bus service route 55 - the Lynx bus costs $2 (kids under 7 free) and you can transfer from one bus to another within 90 minutes at no additional charge. We mostly used the free shuttle, but did manage to easily find our way around on the public buses when necessary. We would definitely book again, the staff were were so welcoming that it was like leaving family when our holiday was over. Great value, fantastic staff, we couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with the most for less”
Reviews.Author: diamondgirl1022
Reviews.Content: We got there a little early and they were very happy to check us in anyway. The rooms were very clean and beds were comfortable like new. The lounge a popular place for not only guest but also locals. Service in lounge and resturant was friendly and fast. The Ladies night on Friday evenings was the best deal i have ever seen. The Karaoke was GREAT. Locals and hotel guests fill the resturant with all ages. Fun for the whole family. I had such a great time i brought my family back 2 weeks later to see the Shuttle launch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms good food friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jan50795
Reviews.Content: Room was part of a free trip and I was very skeptical after reading some of the reviews. We could see the place had been renovated and the rooms were nice and clean. We were prepared to find our own hotel as we could afford to do so and was really afraid the place would be a dump. What a wonderful surprise! Staff was very nice. Jessica in the dining room and the Chef Mark were wonderful. The food is very good, they make a lot from scratch, the taco salad bowl is homemade and was great! We were there 2 nights and I would say again. We didn't go in the pool however there were a few people in the one evening and the pool looked really nice. I don't usually write reviews but because I was so afraid after reading some of the reviews before we went I want to ease the minds of those that may be thinking of booking a room. I noticed another row of empty rooms and was told those will be renovated in the future and will then be booked also. I could see that anyone that stayed before renovation would have a problem as I do think the old rooms would have been in bad shape. Nice place, as I said, I would stay again. Hope this helps anyone with a reservation. The beds were new and comfortable also.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the lounge and you'll see ...ask for Pam or jonh best customer services ever there just there....and ...great pools.”
Reviews.Author: dionnyspily
Reviews.Content: Get the price on line or call do not walk on in .. I repeat do not walk in .. just call from the corner you'll get better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Get the most for your money.”
Reviews.Author: bnp373
Reviews.Content: We wanted a pool side room on the 1st floor by the covered pool. One was not immediately available but we were told to come back after noon. There was still not one available. We asked the next day and a different front desk person (this time male not female) said one was not available but "let's see what I can do". He did his computer thing and switches some things around and we got a great ground floor room by the pool. So, sometimes it is not the hotel but who is at the desk that counts. We stayed 14 days and found the staff very friendly and helpful (except for the 1st female desk person we encountered). We stayed around the hotel for 4 of the 14 days and just used the pool which felt like a warm to hot bath. The spa was great and the one time it was not very hot they fixed it within the hour. We used the laundry twice and it was not very expensive with quite a few machines. We did not have to wait either time. Yes we could complain about the noise outside, but that was just kids having fun and if we wanted quiet we would not have chosen a room by the pool. We could complain about them closing down the pool when the bacteria count got to high but they treated it and reopened by the next morning and this is better than making us sick from the pool. I read the reviews before we left and found most of the complaints had no validity. You can not blame the hotel for the weather or guests noise or attitude or behavior. So all I can say is all the staff were friendly and most were helpful. The rooms were clean, the towels were fluffy. The price was certainly right. The hotel is not fancy but neither is the price and from my point of view we got much more than we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Do not consider it”
Reviews.Author: marieanddon
Reviews.Content: Stayed only because part of holiday package. Have visited Kissimmee over the years at least 30 times, this hotel not worth staying at. There are plenty of cheap and good hotels in area. Its to far away from most things, rooms old, (our first room offered had head board removed and on floor), maid service poor (no service for 2 days even with request).

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: hamptonusn
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced was awesome. The Ms. Vasquez , who assisted us, was very professional, courteous and simply a pleasure to deal with. We loved the room we stayed in. The area the room was in was nice and quiet. The location was impeccable. It was near everything we needed to make our weekend getaway spectacular. What made the trip was the customer service we received. It's nice to not only stay somewhere affordable but to also be treated so well... Can't wait to book another getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, You Will be Suprised”
Reviews.Author: chasitymgonzalez
Reviews.Content: This hotel shocked me the moment i walked in. It looked better in person than researching it on the internet. There are 3 pools. The 1 pool has a nice heat temperature to swim at night. The bedroom i stayed in had a beautiful bed and nice little kitchen without the stove. I had a nice cold fridge and microwave. Also lots of cabinet space to store food. Room service was at my door every morning. When i got back my room looked like day 1 all over again. The attractions are amazing around it. Take a free shuttle bus to the parks or pay 2.00 to get u down the highway. This stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “our stay in champions resort”
Reviews.Author: madonna10_11
Reviews.Content: great entertainment,clean rooms,friendly helpful staff,great food,cant wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel for cheap price”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1202
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 2/06/11 to 2/12/11..I booked thru a travel agent and was a little worried after reading some reviews on here..just goes to show you can't always believe what ppl say..I had an easy check in n when I got to my room I was very surprised at how clean it was..housekeeping was good they kept us stocked with what we needed..the hotel has 3 pools and one is covered and heated and also clean..the only complaint is that there's only 1 jacuzzi and its in the back where they barely even rent out there so at nite its secluded which is nice but a little scary..I enjoyed it ..I would recommend this place its not expensive, its decent for the $...ppl who complain r just expecting a 5 star hotel for the 3 star price

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ktholloran
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights there and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were clean a little out dated but nice hopeful they will do some renovations in the future and the pools looked nice but we were too busy to enjoy them. The location was great very close to Disney. The only problem we had during our stay was that the air conditioner was not working properly and we were giving a new room right away. The staff was great and accomodating. Would definitely go back for our next trip to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mystery_Traveler_0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a suprise for me I was hesitant based off the reviews but it really turned out to be a decent place. Now its not the Hilton so dont show up there expecting that but its no dump either. I enjoyed my stay so much I wasnt sure I wanted to share my experience as I might not be able to get a room next time if they are booked up. Rooms were clean and of average size we had no issues with pest or the likes the pillows eh were kinda thin but one call and we had some better ones. Staff was very responsive! I got a great rate and for one night elsewhere was able to stay 3 here, not that we were at the room that much most of the time we were in Disney. Getting to Disney was a breeze the entrance was not too far away and along the way were many places to eat and shop. If you want to go to Disney on a budget consider this hotel you can feel safe and maximize your dollar so you can spend more in the park or maybe the Disney outlet store ;)

Reviews.Title: “if you like cold showers, stay here”
Reviews.Author: arkiegirl3773
Reviews.Content: Champions World Resort is a dump. We stayed there for 4 nights and if we had not made our reservations thru a travel company with the soccer organization we were with I would have only been there one night. Of the 4 mornings we got ready....2 of those we had no hot water. One evening our AC didnt work and had to call in maintance late one night after kids were asleep and we were ready for bed. The tolite flushed every other flush, the safe didnt work, the "rooms wtih a view" are simply in a covered area where the pool is so the noises echo. The staff was rude and made no attempts to compensate me for my horrible stay. The maintance man argued with me about the water temp. I am not picky--we knew when we made our reservations that we were not staying in a 5 star hotel and I can over look a lot,,,,,,but I CAN NOT over look taking cold showers and not having AC and having staff not believe me. Pro, this place is in a good location. It is a very easy drive to the Disney parks. There are several resturants, target and Walmart very close. The bed was comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rip off - horrible. Stench room, badly built bathroom,”
Reviews.Author: nkumaran
Reviews.Content: Wow amazing rip off. This place is horrible. Stench room, badly built bathroom, unsecured parking, insane price, price gouging on everything on top if the insane nightly price, and when I needed something taken care of during the day when I didn't have time to go back to the hotel they couldn't be bothered to answer the phone. This hotel takes tourism town rips off to new heights. I did not stay here, since it's insane to stay in this horrible hotel, i'll just take a another hotel. Don’t even think about this hotel. Not even dreams.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE>>>Unless you like overflowed toliets, roaches, etc etc”
Reviews.Author: beenplaces_78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a football group, and it was a NIGHTMARE. Long story short the health department was called due to the toilets overflowing to the rooms below. The beds were broken, the doors would not lock and roaches came out at night. When tried to approach any management, they wanted you to prove water was leaking all over the rug, and when you did they just moved you to another room.....which was worse. I was also fooled by the good reviews this place got, and now believe its the staff just trying to offset all the bad reviews. I was also there the week of Dec 6 and for anyone to say they relaxed in the pool is insane. The weather was recorded breaking COLD and never exceeded 60 degrees, and the pool was murky as heck! Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive for the money and the location”
Reviews.Author: Curt_68
Reviews.Content: I thought I and my husband would try and new hotel usually we stay at a hotel in orlando across from universal studios but when i ask to stay a xtra night they priced an exsorbrant amount we could not afford so we decided to try a new one. when we got there we found to our tired surprise this hotel was better than the others. we had come across scince we have had to make trips to the tampa general hospital. The room was visiably old but has been refurbished to almost new state and the staff was very helpful when we checked in the bar staff was auesome even though we don't drink but she hooked us up with some auesome fruit smoothies. dee lish yum! the heated pool was not heated for some reason could not find out why but it was still refreshing and relaxing. The maid service was great and the other staff curtous. we walk all over the hotel very impressed with the renovations. I will be staying again and so will the rest of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok.”
Reviews.Author: Mrive008
Reviews.Content: The tub was dirty when I arrived at the hotel. The water was not working properly. There was a pungent smell in the room. They came and cleaned the tub later on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: deavion
Reviews.Content: The Champions World Resort is one of the best hotel in the area of Kissimmee, Florida, personnel is the best, excellent room and cleanes altought rooms have all equipment necesary to expend the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tracycUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and met all our needs. It is a bit dated but it was very clean. Large room with 2 double beds, fridge, microwave, safe (no deposit required), free parking, table with 2 chairs, tv, shower, coffee maker with free coffee, etc that was replenished each day. Room cleaned daily with fresh towels. Cheap bar prices, 5 bottles beer for $10, margarita $3. Situated close to Disney World and shops and restaurants. Free shuttle to Disney Parks if required. Overall we had a fantastic stay here.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: asmz35
Reviews.Content: The Champions World Resort is in an ideal location close to both Disneyworld and Seaworld and the other major parks. The hotel is located a little farther west along the 192 than we had previously stayed, but as we had a car this really didn't matter. The rooms really were very clean and quite spacious. Although we never used them there is both a fitness centre and games room. The staff were extremely helpful, really friendly and make you feel very welcome. After looking through some of the reviews on this site, I can only say that we never experienced any of the problems that people are complaing about. We had a lovely time and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “It is one of the best stays i had in florida.”
Reviews.Author: lordrod96
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my stay in this resort.i would recommend it to my friends and family.it is close to disney and thats good for the family.they keep the resort clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic budget hotel - outdated”
Reviews.Author: NYSTravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights (Sept 21 - 26, 2010) to golf and visit Disney's Animal Kingdom. Our room was on the second floor and was basic room. It was clean but the fixtures were very dated. The water knobs in the shower both had a C for cold water on them and we didn't have hot water. I called the front desk and someone was there in about 30 minutes to fix it. On Saturday night, the room next door was very noisy in the early morning hours making it difficult to sleep. The walls are thin and we could hear several people talking loudly and laughing. I called the front desk and they were going to send security to check it out. The noise did not stop and we decided to get up and check out very early in the morning. I went to the desk to check out and asked about the noisy room next door. The nighttime clerk said there was a wedding on Saturday and the wedding party had the room next to us. These people were drinking outside until the early hours of the AM and then moved the party to a room. The people in the room on the other side of the wedding party were also checking out and also complained. The clerk listed to my complaint, asked if I wanted another room and I told her we were checking out and flying back home today. Wedding parties should be given rooms away from other vacationers so that people who want to sleep can do so. The staff were friendly but with the minor problems we experienced, we would not stay there again. Last year we stayed at the Radisson down the road and did not experience any of these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Really not that bad, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: dsh1979
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the check in desk, were allocated adjoining rooms on the first floor, rooms 253 & 255. me and partner were in 253, parents in 255. opened the door, room was clean, no funny smells, and beds very comfortable. had a fridge (with freezer compartment), microwave and coffee maker (which coffee was provided every day). i had no complaints at all. in my parents room the door lock was faulty and they had to try the card about 5-10 times each time to get in there, contacted reception who sent someone straight away but it was a old lock and just refused to open first time, but we didn't want to change rooms so left it at that.
