There was free wifi availabile, it said in the rooms, and it was for the first day then then it didnt seem to work, asked reception who said the hotel had been hit by lightening and wiped everything out, so we had to travel to the lobby to use it there instead. always fresh towels, if needed or not and beds changed frequently throughout the 2 weeks stay. pools were clean (although some dirty **** did decide to take a sh1t in the undercover pool one day, but there was always the other pool to use while it was being cleaned and that was not the hotels fault, they didnt know until i told them. No bugs in the room at all. There was some outside the door but there was absolutely nothing the hotel could have done to stop a fly or too taking a seat on the handrail. all in all, a good value place to stay in a great location. rooms could do with a lick of paint but they ain't that dated. i would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “National Catholic Church of North America Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Jim34787
Reviews.Content: We held our yearly retreat for Bishops, Priests and Deacons at Champions World Resort in Kissimmee. Everything went so smoothly from the initial contact with our sales rep, Maria Rolon, to the quality of the meeting room which was converted to both a meeting room and chapel for Mass. The breakfasts and lunch was great and Patsy our server attended to every detail. Rooms were affordable, clean and had all the needed amenities. Staff could not do enough to assist us in any way necessary. Bishop Terry on Sunday stated that he would like to see next year's retreat back at Champions World Resort. We highly recommend and give it our full blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as these reviews”
Reviews.Author: alypaige
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I won a trip to this resort, so we decided to go, even after reading the horrible reviews online. We decided we could always go to Days Inn if it was that bad. Upon arrival, the outside looks nice. There's a bright playground in front and the lobby was nice and renovated. The guy working there was very nice and helpful. We were staying in building E. As we opened the door, we were a little apprehensive, but it was clean. There was nothing special about it, but I didn't see any mold or bugs anywhere. The vents in the ceiling were very dusty, but otherwise, the room itself was fine. The toilet didn't flush very well, so we went to the lobby if we had any heavy duty bathroom needs. Also, all their mattresses are supposedly new Sealy Posturepedics. Ours were both so hard, we had trouble sleeping at night and woke up with stiffness. The lobby offers free wi-fi if you ask for the password at the desk. There were supposedly three pools. We swam in the "covered" pool, which was pretty old, but clean. One of the "sun" pools was closed, and we didn't check the third one. Everything is pretty spread out. Also, the clientele that we saw tended to be pretty hillbilly. Anyway, I think we were happy because we had very low expectations, and it wasn't terrible. If you're on a budget, I'd say go ahead and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain at the Price”
Reviews.Author: joancrounse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after returning from a cruise. Nice room, extremely clean with comfortable beds, helpful front desk staff. The hotel itself is well-kept, pool is nice. No noise noticed from other rooms even though there were guests in rooms on either side of us. We paid $40 for a triple which was good for a hotel a step above many others on Irlo Bronson. Would definitely stay again at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: dijana123
Reviews.Content: stayed there for seven days aircon did not work they said they would fix it but for days went by and still no aircon every time i spoke to front desk they said some one would fix it also they have holiday inn rep at desk she tells you to go to orange lake and get a free ticket to disney when you go its a time share they want your credit card so be ware of this scam they change the rep every day would not use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Such a nice hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: JOEHSpfld_il
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at approximately 10 pm, They were nice enough to open the restaurant for our large group of 13. We had no trouble finding it as it was close to the theme parks. Super nice covered pool, nice rooms and very helpful friendly staff, I would certainly stay there again on my next visit. Thanks to the young waiter who served us at that late hour!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rogerc733
Reviews.Content: The most recent of several week or more stays at this hotel. Ownership has changed since first visit in 1984 when it was the Regency. Most recently Howard Johnson's and now Champions World Resort. I have returned with my family which now includes two granddaughters in 2003, 2006, 2007, and now 2010. Have been extremely pleased with the accommodations each time. The rooms and bathrooms are large and super clean. Beds comfortable. The grounds beautifully landscaped with palm trees and shrubs, etc. Location close to Disney (about 3 miles) but far enough to be in a quiet area. Plenty of fine restaurants, stores, and other attractions nearby. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Florida. The room rates are just right for people looking for reasonable accommodations. The staff friendly and helpful. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Aviscowboy
Reviews.Content: This place was great. Housekeeping cleaned our room and made beds every day. 3 pools, hot tub and kiddie pool. Large outdoor athletic complex in the back. Shuttle service to the theme parks was very prompt. The food in the restaurant was cheaper and filling. Out buy the back pool there is a barbeque area for those that want to eat on a dime. Close to a convienance store, on the bus line (lynx #55), close to subway, and pizza. Staff was very professional and worked hard to make your stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Yulk, Oh My Goodness, Couldn't Have Been Worse, Don't Book Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Denise214
Reviews.Content: We were suppose to have a great room, we stayed here for a whole week and we stayed out of the room more than we were in it. I mean we go there and had to wait 45 minutes before we got a room. We booked 3 rooms. There was no refrigerator, microwave, and needles to say they wanted us to use the same towels over and over again. NO WAY!!!! My room was molded in corners, the sheets had BLOOD!!!!! on them, the service was sickening. There were only 6 channels on the tv, no dvd hookup, or anything. The pictures are a lie. Internet didnt work either. DONT Book Here, spend those extra bucks and go somewhere else PLEASE!!!!!!! I wouldnt let my dog stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Fraud (visa) problems”
Reviews.Author: verstraetekris
Reviews.Content: Hallo travelers, don't booked this hotel because we had a fraud problem wit it! When we came back home, we received our visa list and their was a payment of 35 euro of it. Somebody of this hotel copied our visa (because you have to give your visa as garauntee when you check-in) and booked a hotel in the same road as our hotel. We can proof that we didn't booked that hotel because we check-in miles away in another hotel. We accuse somebody of this hotel because it's not a coicidence that they pick a hotel just in the same road that we booked a hotel in Orlando (and their are 1000 hotels in Orlando). We send a mail with the proof to this hotel and the didn't send any reaction back... so this means for us that they are guilty and shows which kind of client service! ! We think they booked the hotel and cancel it (before 48 hours) and so they get the money! It's not a big amount but if they do this with 10 persons it's a big sum! So be careful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I send the proof with this mail.... so everybdy can see this kind of fraud!

Reviews.Title: “This was an great value for the money. We...”
Reviews.Author: Dharris122
Reviews.Content: This was an great value for the money. We have been back a few times and brought the dog along for the fun.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vases25
Reviews.Content: We should have took notice of the previous reviews !!!! We have stayed in many hotels and motels in Florida for the last 20 years and can honestly say this was by far THE WORST - Do not stay here. Room had no fridge, we had to ask twice on first day . Safe closed shut so unable to use it. Hairdryer did not work right, had to hold button in and it was crackling so not safe to use. The noise here is horrendous, there are hundreds of kids in all three pools, and running along the walkways until the early hours. The few parents we saw seemed to be mexicans or cubans shouting to one another across the complex. Doors banging and kids/people screaming until 3.17am and then started again at 5.00am. The health authority closed the jacuzzi/ spa as notice said it not good for our health! No wonder, the spa and pools were never closed for cleaning etc. We told the reception we were checking out for a few days ( to get some peace ) and asked them to leave the fridge ( which we eventually got delivered ) in our room. Came back after a week hoping all the kids had gone home, and found place was even worse. Someone had also removed the fridge again ! Complained to reception and was told one would be brought back up ( never arrived so nothing to keep food and drink cool ) Came back to room later on to find the card not opening door. husband went to ask twice for another and they didnt work either. Eventually they sent a man to take lock off which took him an hour with my husband helping him. Tried sleeping there again but it was an absolute hellhole with all the noise. After 2 hours sleep I went to reception to complain and told them we were checking out for good as the place was terrible. Asked what happened to the fridge and was told they were still looking for one ( after 24 hours ! ) I told her no-one should have removed it in the first place as we were paying for the room etc. The stuff in room was old and odour not pleasant. Never offered us a refund so told her, the place was a terrible dump and we were going to find a decent place. I feel sorry for anyone who has gone to Florida for the first time and was put in this place. Do not go there. By the way, we checked into Hampton Inn and it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Gross, loud, hell”
Reviews.Author: adele295
Reviews.Content: Let's start by saying what you see on line is NOT what you get. Beds are only a full size. Pillows are old. Beddings was itchy maybe bed bugs but I have no light to see just yet. No hot water. No way would I stay here again. No wonder why they have posted "no refunds". If you have a need for sleep forget that as the bar was jamming so loud I should have called the cops. Then when the room next door took a shower @ 2 am for an hour it sounded like I was in the same room. AC can not be set any lower then 72 which at 2 pm in Fl does not cut it! I called ahead of time to plan this time spoke to sales dept not front desk and they never told the whole truth on anything!

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: jo13
Reviews.Content: had a 2 week stay here never again,on arrival got given room key opened door to room and the smell that greeted us was not good went back to recepion got another room didnt smell but thats all it had going for it.when i booked it it said you get fridge.microwave,coffee maker,safe(at a local charge)hairdryer,iron and board,what we got was tv(with no remote)hairdryer with broken plug,sink with no stopper,a safe(which wasn't bolted to anything so not very safe)very uncomfortable bed and the room(642)was so dark you had to always have lights on.even had to go and buy a kettle what a joke.did have housekeeping in a couple of times but didnt bother to much as couldnt even make a bed.on the plus side we never stay long in hotel room but just sleeping there was enough.i have stayed at alot of hotels/motels in orlando and this was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: sk_jj9
Reviews.Content: Ive just stayed at the hotel with my friend for 2weeks. We had one query through our stay and that was just how to work the safe, however after speaking with reception 5minutes later someone came and sorted it. I felt for the price we paid the hotel was fine, 2 double beds, tele, safe, bathroom (with bath and shower) table & chairs. The cleaners came in everyday and changed the towels. The location was a little further away from the parks than others id stayed at (mainly Universal being aound 30mins away, but still not ages away) There was a pizza hut, subway, shops & fuel all on the same road. I think most people who slate this hotel are mainly looking for a 5* after paying for a 2/3* hotel. If all your after is somewhere to chill out and sleep after a long day at the parks then this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: JustVisitingfromTX
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a late check in. Had to tell the staff numerous times that we had multiple vehicles and needed additional parking passes. Were not given the "welcome" package because we had ordered our tickets to attractions ahead of time. Rooms were adequately sized but were musty smelling. It was hard to get the rooms to cool down to a comfortable temperature. the covered pool was not as pictured -- was much smaller. No pool towels for the majority of our stay. While we did not feel unsafe, it was a little alarming to have people standing outside of our hotel doors just hanging out until 1 and 2 in the morning. Kids were running up and down the halls at all hours. Never saw any type of security. The positive things was the rate -- it was cheap. So really, we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Will I stay there!!!”
Reviews.Author: chteda
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights and I've never stayed at a hotel this bad. First night we got there we were in the 200 rooms and there was black hair everywhere in the bathroom and sink, popcorn on the side of the bed, holes in the blanket. I called the front desk and it took awhile before they came to clean it. The guy came twice and still it wasn't clean. He left the hair in the bath tub. I called the front desk and still had problems. I told him tomorrow we will be gone all day to the theme park to make sure it was clean.He told me it will be clean.We got back to the hotel late and my kids were sleep. The hair was still in the bath tub. They changed my room late. I was pissed! I check out the room it was right in front of the park it was clean this time but when I took a shower there was water under the tub and it came out in the floor and they never fixed it while I was there. They kept telling me somone was coming but nobody never did!Also the wasnt no pressure out the shower. The housekeeping didnt know english it was loud on a couple nights by the bar. I spoke to the manager a few times and still no results. I would never still there again not even for free.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price-you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Megga-Traveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed from June 13th thru June 19th. Very outdated hotel. Rooms were ok. Free Wi-Fi but very slow. Beds were made every day. The main pool was not that great. Yes it was covered but lots of screaming kids and cloudy. I went and checked out one of the other pools. Much nicer even though it was not covered. Very noisey at night because of the pool being open till 11:00 with a D.J. Thank goodness we were not in a room close to the covered pool or we would have asked to be moved. If you want a little more quiet, I would suggest staying in one of the other buildings away from the covered pool. The only complaint I have is I had made a special request to have a certain amount of towels in my room but that didn't happen. Maybe there was a language problem and they couldn't read my note cause it was in English. Don't know. I'm a tipper of the maid service to my room so if I don't get a simple request takencare of, I don't tip. The one thing positive I can say is the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT, SUPERB & BEST ACCOMODATION IN ORLANDO USA”
Reviews.Author: lancslads
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a 2 week holiday in Kissimmee, Orlando, USA. We stayed at Champions World Resort (FORMERLY HOWARD JOHNSON MAINGATE WEST ) for our FIFTH time and yet again we had a wonderful holiday there, the rooms are massive and very very clean the staff are very attentive and are extremely helpful, there is a TV provided at no cost to help you with what’s on in Kissimmee and the surrounding area, the bed are comfortable and changed daily , we were provided with a fridge, Microwave and coffee maker which included a daily supply of ground coffee & sugar, the bathrooms are a really good size and good quality towels, shampoo ,soap and moisturising cream provided daily , there is a safe provided in every room and accessed by a personal code for security, the rooms are serviced everyday and kept to a very high standard, right from the start of checking in to checking out we were looked after, nothing is too much trouble for the staff or management. The pools and pool areas are cleaned daily and towels are provided at poolside. We didn’t eat at the hotel, so cannot comment on the food but did hear other guest compliment the food and the service, we used the bar on a few occasions and the staff are very friendly and provide good service and ice cold beer, a special thank you to the night manager and Jenny Vazquez for all their help and assistance during our stay, you went above your expected duties, “THANK YOU “ We would definitely recommend a stay at Champions World Resort as it is excellent all round value for money and you are guaranteed superb first class accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Good customer service !”
Reviews.Author: ivy3543
Reviews.Content: Very Good service, clean, fast access to the mayor highways, really good location !

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a great deal for a large party and a tight budget.”
Reviews.Author: clunford
Reviews.Content: I am always looking for a nice clean hotel on a single parent budget. The room was spacious, slept 6 and the beds were comfortable. A nice retaraunt & lounge with great dinner and drink specials. We are planning to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: jr88amp
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 days, Doors dont close properly, Key cards do not work consistently. They do not provide good service. My Vacation though short, was longer that a rough week at work. Trying to get what you ask for keys to work, refrigerator in a room (after you request one at the time of reservation). Non smoking rooms are placed right behind smoking rooms, so smoke smell comes through air vents. DJ played at pool till 1230 pm louder than hell. I would rather pay 100 dollars a night than save the money. Much less hassle! They would not let me in my room til it was paid in full, and they are refunding my money for my stay, however they say it can take 14 business days to receive it. That's funny. NOT! I wouldn't put my worst enemy in this hotel, EVER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value very clean”
Reviews.Author: philcastora
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean and staff very freindly. good hotel for less than many others

Reviews.Title: “Not friendly staff working there”
Reviews.Author: lilsiso373
Reviews.Content: When you get there it appears nice from outside and then when you go in the rooms you see it needs to be vaccummed and dusted. They said there would be a refrigerator in room that we requested and there wasn't any. A person was going to bring one and then they said we had to switch rooms, A/C old and loud. Card keys to get in a real joke, 6 tries to get in. Non smoking means you aren't smoking but someone's smoke can come in right next to you. If you want to sleep I suggest don't room by the pool, DJ at night on weekend keeps you up after tiring day and then cleaning lady bangs on door in morning at 8:30 to get in!!!! Not much sleep that night. Never again will I stay there!

Reviews.Title: “BEST GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: FINEANDFOXXY4U
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything I wanted !!!!!! all I wanted was to relax and they have the space to do it. Something for my sons to do to keep them out of my hair for a couple of hours. There is a basketball court and tennis court that kept my sons busy while the sun set. There is THREE pools that stay open until eleven pm to help them relax before bed. There was children movies playing for the ones that did not want to go to the pool. I truly enjoyed my stay here. There was not a thing I asked for that the hotel staff did not provide. The rooms was well kept, service came with a smile, for the amount we paid I will be there again.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: dmferre
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to this hotel for quite a few years and we always enjoyed the cleanliness, courteous and efficient staff. Its very quiet because you are on the other side of Orlando and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Disney_Fans4Ever
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property a few times. The staff is friendly, rooms are clean and the price is great! We have not had a chance to enjoy the pools yet but all the other families really seem to enjoy them. We look forward to going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money,location, and pools.”
Reviews.Author: madeemae07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, people were very friendly and helpful. There were 3 pools on site and a kiddie pool which my little ones loved. And my husband and i enjoyed the hot tub so refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Was very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: TudsM
Reviews.Content: We were originally due to stay for 10 nights and we booked for three people - my teenager daughter and her friend and myself. On arrival in the room the beds were very small double beds and only two of them - I spoke to the manager who said that all the rooms were exactly the same (untrue) and that for an extra $10 we could have a rollaway bed. The rooms are far too small for more than two people. The site is not well maintained and the pool not clean. We were then stranded due to the volcano and having enquired about staying for an additional five nights was told that we could have a special price of $39 per night - only to find out on the website for the hotel that the cost for that period of time would be $32 per night. Scammed!!! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone - there are far better places to stay which are closer to the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay for a resonable rate.”
Reviews.Author: SOCKS2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this motel when it was a Howard Johnson. We were impressed with it then, but really like it now. My husband was greeted with kindness and respect by Jenny Vazquez. He informed her that we needed a room and that I was in a wheelchair. She said she had an handicapped room with a shower that I could be wheeled into. I had showered before we came over because I knew I could not get into a shower or tub. I am in a cast and cannot put any weight on my foot whatsoever. Joe jumped at the chance to let me get a shower. He booked the room and we headed over to check it out. It was exciting to see that I would be able to slide out of my chair and onto the bench without any problems. I was going to take the bed by the wall because it was closer to the bathroom, but I could not get the wheelchair in the space. It would be nice if you could push the beds just a little closer. I also noticed you had a bar behind the yoilet, but youy really can't use it to get up and down. All in all, we were very impressed with the room. We like the fridge and microwave, the amnenties that were provided and the access to the room from the parking lot. We had a delicious breakfast the next morning. The selection was very nice and the price was good. The dining room was very spacios and very pleasant,plus the waitress was very concerned that we were getting everything we needed. The lobby is beautiful, the store attrative and well stocked. and the restrooms were very clean. YES! We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ssniff05
Reviews.Content: The internet pictures and information can be very deceiving. The beds were extremely uncomfortable (HARD) , the AC did not cool the room at night when you were sleeping. I was sweating and we had no WI FI all weekend because it was down and they wanted to charge me $.38 per minute to use their internet. The buffet was $8.50 per adult and they do nto tell you that until after you have eaten. A total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Scary! We stayed one night and left...”
Reviews.Author: sherylschwoy
Reviews.Content: Scary! We stayed one night and left! Drunks, people throwing things at the wall behind us! Pros-bucket of beer and two dollar margaritas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BasscymroWales
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times over the past few years and have always been satisfied. The last time, we asked the front desk clerk for a poolside room and were told that none was available. He gave us an outside room but when we got there we found that the toilet backed up when flushed. We asked for a move within one hour and were then given a poolside room, which had to have been available in the first place! Why did he not give it to us when asked? Was he just trying to be smart? After a few hours rest in our "new" room, we decided to go out to eat but could not open the room door! The lock was stuck and would not budge. I called the front desk and said that we wanted to go out, to which he replied "go ahead". I deserved that! When I explained the problem, he sent up a maintenence man who looked like Jed Clampett from Beverly Hill Billys. This guy was very friendly and tried his best but he could not open the door. Eventually, he passed me a wrench through the gap under the door and told me to bust the lock with brute force! This I did and we were released! These were amusing episodes and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is clean, there are no bugs and the pools are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tarah18
Reviews.Content: This place was nicer than I expected. I booked 5 nights orginally and ended up staying longer for a total of 8 nights. We stayed in the Deluxe pool room which overlooked the pool. The room was is very spacious,clean, and included a frig, microwave, and coffee maker. The hotel is in a great location. Feels very safe staying here. I've stayed in Disney hotels before and that was a concern before I stayed here but it's no longer a certain. The drive to Disney is about a 10 minture drive. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Low Quality Motel”
Reviews.Author: JTP69
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed the night we arrived at the champions resort. I felt totally misled by the beautiful pictures on the internet. The rooms were old. The walls needed to be painted. There was smell of mildew and old worn dirtiness. The covers were old and God knows how many germs from people were in the thread of the covers, as they were poor quality and worn. The carpets were dirty. We had 12 rooms. A few showers did not work or did not have hot water. I was afraid to allow the children to lean on the railings out on the balcony because it was a piece of wood nailed into another piece of wood. Horrible appearance. It was bad. I did not allow the children to lay on the beds. You would think after this place received a review on bed bugs this past February, they would invest in buying new linen and covers for the beds. They did not. It was disgusting. Really. We took our belongings and left the motel the same night. That was the best thing we did. We went to another hotel nearby and had a good nights sleep without worrying about filth and bugs. I would NOT recommend this motel to anyone. Management should be ashamed of themselves.

Reviews.Title: “the pools were wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cordem4073
Reviews.Content: just returned from our stay at champions world resort. Stayed there for 4 nights. The 3 pools were great my kids loved them. The volleyball and basketball courts were nice. The room had a musty smell at first, we went and bought some candles and took care of that. If you want towels and wash cloths get them in pm for the next day cause the next morning they wont have any clean. For the price our stay was good. Front desk people could be taught some manners but other wise would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, clean & near all, the perfect resort for groups!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanniemol1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Champions resort from March 27-29, 2010. I stayed in a Deluxe poolside room with my husband & one of our friends visiting from NY. We also booked another couple from Daytona & then our friends brother. The rooms were clean and we had no problems. When we needed extra towels they were brought right up. We were meeting old coworkers from NY at Downtown Disney. We couldn't use the shuttles because we planned to be back late. The 2.00 Maragaritas in the lounge weren't the greatest. That would be my only complaints. But for the price (we used the last minute Kissimmee rates) you cannot beat the value. We are thinking of setting up a reunion for next year using this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful - what more can I say?”
Reviews.Author: dvbsk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in June '08. We had a problem with the safe not working in our room but once reported to the check in desk, we were offered another room which we gladly accepted. The rooms are very basic but saying that we only used our room to sleep in as we were out in the parks all day (which are only a short 10 min drive away). It looks like this hotel has had a "make over" since I went in '08. I would recommend this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fantastic Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: cloudy29
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel before we travelled had me very worried. On arriving at the hotel the receptionist check in was speedy and friendly. We went to our room to find it clean very clean fresh bedding and I checked thoroughly! Hot water so hot you could have almost burnt yourself (so all the moans about hot water not being hot is utter rubbish). The pools were clean and well maintained. The breakfast was great Jose in the breakfast area was helpul and friendly at breakfast. Reception staff also went the extra mile to help. On one occassion we messed up our safe, on ringing reception they told me a guy from maintenence would be at our room soon, within minutes hed arrived and fixed it. The gentleman in the bar at the evening was most friendly and charming and the food great. The shuttle to Disney ran on time and as scheduled, also the same with the shopping mall shuttle. The grounds around the hotel were lovely and again well maintained. Each day on our return to our room after the parks, the rooms had been cleaned fresh towels and bedding and to our amazement more than often the maid had even tidied up!!!!! This hotel is similar to a Travellodge here in UK but better and cleaner. All l have left to say is this hotel is Fantasic and I cant wait to come back Thank you so much to all its lovely staff for helping in making a great holiday for myself husband and two small children. THANK YOU ! Beverley Lancashire UK

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: handofgod7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located nearby to Disney. As of hotel room amenities, there was microwave, safe, television. I didn't like the AC, but that's ok I guess for the price I paid. Over all good, would stay again

Reviews.Title: “worst motel”
Reviews.Author: dap56
Reviews.Content: We saw this place online for cheep so we decided to stay for $32 a night we thought great deal. Not a great place at all we arrived late and checked in then they wanted us to talk to the frount person so we did. Spent 1hr with him he told us that we can get a free breakfast if we went through a time share which he said was not one. They had free shuttles to Disney. We were told that the shuttle only pickes pick up in magic kingdom and that we had to be back by 925 at night in order to get picked up and they ended up going to epcot any way and they were late . the shower did not have cold water and the beds felt like you were sleeping on rocks. and we could here the family next to us the walls werenot proof. It was not what it looked on the net

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Champions World Resort!”
Reviews.Author: klynne2
Reviews.Content: The snowstorms on the East Coast delayed our trip and we had to scramble at the last minute to rebook our flight and our hotel. Our favorite hotel was not available for our new travel dates, of course, so I logged on to travelocity and prayed. I found several hotels in my price range, which is budget, and then logged on over to TripAdvisor to compare the reviews. Champions World Resort had the best reviews of my selections and so I called and booked it. Since I don't rent a car, the hotel I use has to have shuttles to the Disney Parks, Seaworld Parks, and Universal. Our 10 day vacation got cut to 7 days with the new flight arrangements and the girls, my daughter, her best friend, and granddaughter were already dissappointed. I wanted to find a hotel they would enjoy, with a pool, gameroom, playground, etc. Champions had all of the above. Since I have to hire a ride from the airport to the hotel I inquired of Champions if they had a service for airport arrivals. They had me call a local service that they use that gives Champion's guests a discount. Of course I shopped around, and the rate by USA Tours that Champion told me about were the lowest, about $20 less per trip. I was very pleased by that even before we arrived. Our poolside room had a microwave and fridge, and that was great! Plus, it overlooked the covered pool. The girls barely dragged their suitcased into the room before changing and heading out to the pool! They had a great time, and even got to swim one warm day that was too rainy for the parks. The room was clean and cozy, although a bit old. The beds were comfy and the coffee maker worked. I was very happy! The lobby had a diningroom that offered a very reasonable breakfast buffet with kids free. It was quick and convenient for the days we were going to the parks and the coffee was very good. I got a cup to go most mornings for the shuttle ride. The shuttle to the various parks is such a convenience, and a must for me as I don' t rent a car. It saves a ton of money! It was always exactly on time! The ride to the parks was about a half hour each way. The lobby also had a little store with pre-packaged foods and snacks, milk ,etc. And thank goodness, razors, for 25c each. The girls did not bring razors and they planned to sunbathe at Aquatica so it was a minor crisis averted. I was able to log on to the free wifi on my laptop with no problem, but it was a bit slower than I am used to. The staff was amazing! Rodrigo, who was in the lobby most nights and answered the phones was always friendly and helpful when I called about shuttle times, pizza delivery, quarters for the onsite laundry room, etc. The gentleman who worked in the lobby store was helpful with restaurant suggestions and came to the rescue with shampoo and the 25c razors! There is Dominos and Subway right across the road, and a gift shop next door. For not having a rental car the location was quite nice with everything we need a quick walk away. The girls loved Champions and had a great time. I would definately return again for the price and the service!

Reviews.Title: “Place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: fawlcon
Reviews.Content: Spots of mold in room & bathroom. Wear sandals IN the room, carpet is filthy. Mattresses old, sheets scratchy (cheap & threadbare). Bar is unattractive & very basic, garishly & brightly lit. In Orlando, you can a whole lot better than this place, for the same money. Avoid this place !

Reviews.Title: “The best resort to play and stay at when visiting Disney!”
Reviews.Author: pichike
Reviews.Content: My spouse and children enjoyed the tennis court, the kids' playground, and we had a blast playing softball. The tours to and from Disney should have more trips scheduled, but overall we enjoyed our trip. Thanks for the memories!

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: kmwBracknell
Reviews.Content: Never been to a place so appalling!!!!! In the space of two weeks we had been moved into 3 rooms, the first was dirty and the door didn't shut properly, the 2nd lead to us all having bites from bed bugs which was confirmed by an exterminator, the 3rd didn't have hot water actually we had to turn the tap on for 20 mins before the water would even come out, by then we were past even complaining to the hotel as no appologies were ever given intead we went to our Holiday Rep!!! For 1 or 2 nights I'm sure you would survive but for a two week holiday there are other places for the same price to stay!!!!!! It is supposedly "the place that champions stay" how wrong did they get that???? NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT TOO BAD FOR CHEAP PRICE-WOULD STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: hottoddkris
Reviews.Content: Great location to celebration- I-4 and family entertainment. I had read reviews but was surprised the rooms smelled clean, the beds were comfortable, the pool and hot tub large and well maintained. a larger resort, but if there for cheap price not bad. I have stayed in Best Westerns that the rooms cost alot more and really were no better. Shower was strong and Hot. We did not have a coffee pot though but otherwise check in was smooth. entrance locks were older and bathroom ceiling could use up date, but could tell new tub/tub surround and toilet. For the price would definately stay again. No damage to my vehicle and I drive a Nissan 350Z

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again - NO HOT WATER”
Reviews.Author: nole808
Reviews.Content: I'm definately not a hotel snob, and considering most of my time would be spent at Disney, I thought a $30/night place to sleep would be okay. But this place wasn't even worth that! The room smelled like a typical MOTEL, which was what I expected. However, what made this hotel not worth a dime was the fact that it had NO HOT WATER! For 2 days, we tried getting the front desk to answer the phone. They attempted to fix it once, but it didn't last for more than 5 minutes. We had to walk to the lobby to complain, and there was a long line of others complaining. We argued and got our money back and checked into another hotel. I would never stay at this hotel again, even if it was free!

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK AND STAY”
Reviews.Author: leaclelland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying here for 2 weeks. we had a really good time. the rooms are spacious and clean. excellant laudry facilities. kids enjoyed heated pool and hot tub. good breakfast and very resonably priced and a good choice. We also had a good meal in the hotel bar. Michelle the waitress is nice and Guy ( chef ) makes a mean coleslaw!!!! Many thanks to Jose, Linda and Patsy for the excellant service at breakfast.When we return to Orlando hopefully in October we will definately be staying at CHAMPIONS WORLD RESORT.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kat094
Reviews.Content: Second time back in three months, fabulous place to stay, great resort, for families couples, people of all ages. Quiet, exceptionally friendly staff, fast service, excellent food great atmosphere everywhere. Close to all parks with free bus service to all. Great pools, very clean rooms, exceptional value, don't want to leave, will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately stay again with my family.”
Reviews.Author: ReneePa
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was great, the rooms were a good size and there was plenty of things to keep the kids busy.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: izzzyFlorida
Reviews.Content: We had reserved 2 rooms and requested them adjoined. When we arrived we were told that they were adjoining but they were not and both rooms smelled very strongly of bleach, so strong that our eyes and throats burned. We did receive new rooms that were adjoining and were satisfied until we decided to go to bed at 8 pm for an early start at Disney. Unfortunately, that was when some screamers chose to go swimming even though it was very cold (probably why they were screaming). We survived that only to have occupants in a neighboring room decide to “converse” very loudly outside of their room for over 2 hours while walking back and forth past our rooms. As they were not speaking English, one of our party who could speak their language was going to ask them to please bring it into their own room. We decided that was the responsibility of this hotel and we called the front desk instead. This was after 2 hours of not being able to get our children or ourselves to sleep. After approximately another hour of these very loud people outside our room, someone finally showed up to request that they quiet down. I can only assume we were not the only ones who complained. Yes, this was a less expensive place to stay but not worth the aggravations and everyone in our party being exhausted the next day. We realize that a hotel cannot always be aware of how their customers behave but if security of some sort were “around”, they would have been aware of this rude behavior and attended to the problem before we had to complain. We did give it quite a while before we did. If we had been forced to approach these people ourselves, we do not know how they would/could have reacted and should not have been put in that position.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jimlinenbrink
Reviews.Content: stayed with a team. room was redone some what clean. ran out of hot water every morning.. NO ESPN!!! this is a sports hotel.. rate was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the website makes it sound.”
Reviews.Author: sherri_annie
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Christmas week. It was cheap for the room. The deluxe continental breakfast was not worth $5.99. The rooms were not quite clean. Each day housekeeping straightened the top covers but not the bottom sheet. The children's playground was not safe. Only one time was the lobby store open during the posted hours. The shuttles takes an hour each way. It stops at 3-4 hotels. It only runs twice in the morning and twice in the evening. The last shuttle is before the fireworks at the parks. If you do not catch the shuttle, it is a $25 taxi ride. Do not be late to catch a shuttle. We got there at 2 minutes late and it had already left. One night the hotel shut the gate and the shuttle could not get in. We had to walk from the street to our rooms. Just what we wanted to do after a day of walking the parks. Never mind carrying a 6 year old that was sleeping. The internet was not fast and most days we could not connect.

Reviews.Title: “ridiculously nasty”
Reviews.Author: shay_denise
Reviews.Content: I found this online...read the reviews some where good and some where bad...THIS IS NOT A RESORT!!!!!!!! It is a standard hotel...making me think i got the best rate. i do not recommend this place. could not enter the room because the door was broken...got in the room carpet was filthy, bed was leaning...mold in the bathroom...remote control did not work. I only stayed like 15 min and they still wanted to charge me...fighting to get my money back now!!!! i end up staying in the westgate resort...very reasonable price and it is absolutely beautiful....Do not stay here you will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: fispip001
Reviews.Content: We viewed some of the reviews of the Champions Resort with some trepidation, However we were pleasantly surprised. True the rooms are a bit dated. but they were kept clean and tidy, the maid and staff being very friendly and approachable. The pools , laundry and exercise room are all very good and well kept, as are the gardens and childrens play area. For a budget complex, it is great for a base, after all we spent most of the time elsewhere. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “champions world”
Reviews.Author: jwtFife
Reviews.Content: just returned after 8 nights at the hojo maingate west, we stayed here a few years ago and found it to be a good location for disney ( 4 miles). recentley it has changed name and has been refurbed new beds carpets etc. Check in area in process of being refurbed but still less than two mins to check in. As a disney type holiday hotel this is ample, rooms cleaned everyday clean towels each morning, three swimming pools onsite restuarant , i would be very happy to stay in this hotel again . thanks to all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: MichaelScott123
Reviews.Content: Champions World Resort was exactly what we were looking for. A brief relaxing weekend near Orlando Fl. The rooms were nice and clean, and the hotel staff was very responsive and attentive to our needs. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: LeaseyLJ
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we were a bit concerned, but were very pleasently suprised. It was our fifth visit to Orlando and this is one of the best accomodations we have stayed in. Maid service every day, clean towels every day and bed sheets changed 4 times a week. Rooms very spacious, two beds, sofa, fridge, safe, tv, coffee maker, digital controlled air con, ironing board, iron and hair dryer all at no extra cost. Also two sinks. No bed bug bites which other people have mentioned they had occured, room very clean. We did have a blocked toilet one day which was reported to reception, by the time i had returned to my room the repair man was already waiting outside my door, he proceeded to sort out the problem immediatley. All the pools were well kept and clean, there was also clean towels for guests to use by the pool side. The hotel is a little further west on the 192 than we have previously stayed, but as we had a car this was not a problem at all. All members of staff that we encountered were friendly and very helpful, we wouldn't stay anywhere else unless we won the lottery! We will definately be returning and telling our friends its the best value hotel we've stayed at. Last thing there is a great Chinese buffet opposite Champions World.

Reviews.Title: “great place, fantastic pools”
Reviews.Author: sianibach
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 weeks, end of september. we had 3 rooms in total, and were all very happy. we spent plenty of time in all 3 of the pools, the one with the jacuzi more so than the others. the rooms were bigger thans ones we had previously stayed at, with 2 bed plus a fold out sofa bed. we only had one complaint and that was that the bar was closed by the time we got back, often before 10, can understand that september can be seen as out of season, but we were on holiday. any way i would reconmend this hotel to anyone, and we will be staying here next time we visit florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Sterling_Family
Reviews.Content: For $35 a night, you can beat this deal. It was no resort by any means but the staff was super friendly, and the pools were nice. The air conditioner acted a bit funny (freezing when on, burning up when off) but the cable channels and mini fridge were nice. The covered pool was dirty on our first day, but it was cleaned the next. The other pools were nice and quiet. Located around many shops and restaurants, and 5 minutes from Disney!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterCityfan1
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a fantastic holiday we had 3 rooms at champions world for ourselves our children and grandchildren and a good time was had by all,the pools were great and kept clean and tidy,fresh towels were supplied poolside,rooms were clean and cleaned daily if we were in maid would come back later,we did not expect clean sheets every day because at home no one changes bed daily so why expect a hotel to,but you are supplied with a card to leave on pillow if you require clean bedding,which we only had to use once when 2 year old had accident.All staff were friendly and helpful,we had asked travel agent for smoking room they had not passed on our request but receptionist rearranged rooms for us,we only had 2 problems with shower and maintenace came right away to repair it,They have a really nice little bar very friendly barstaff,thanks tamara for a really good night,they also have a really nice outside area for smokers.Thanks to all staff for a great stay and for lending us a kettle,we are hoping to return next year and would definatly request your hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy IN Years:What a Deal”
Reviews.Author: phatfillTampa
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews on this location and was a little hesistant on staying here-boy am I happy I chose this location. Hotel was very clean, room was huge, a/c was great and the staff friendly and helpful and it was only 15 minutes from all attractions. The pools were clean and the grounds very attractive. Had breakfast on Sunday-service was good and got my eggs cooked to order without having to wait in long lines. This is the best bang for your buck that you'll find anywhere in the south. Thanks Champion's World Resort-we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: sibs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 22 August to 4 September 2009. This is my second stay here and if I return to Kissimmee would definitely stay here again. My son and I arrived very late at night and simply wanted to sleep. The room smelled of mould but we were so tired I didn't care. By the time my son woke the next morning I had been given another room and had moved all our belongings. No problem - the staff were very helpful. Ten days later I had to move rooms again when the hot water in my block "broke down". Again, the staff were very helpful and apologetic and I was given complimentary breakfast vouchers for the remainder of my stay (without asking!). The pools are immaculately clean and my room was as clean as any I've stayed in in Kissimmee (not up to my standards at home but perfectly acceptable). I have stayed 7 different motels along 192 and for this is better than all the others (bar possibly the Sera Lago) I paid £14 per night (one third of the cost of the Sera Lago) and think it is a real bargain. The hotel is a little off the main drag but as you need a car anyway I did not find this a problem. I'm suprised to read that some people have felt unsafe here. I travelled as a lone female with a 6 year old son and felt very safe. The free wi-fi is a bonus and on the one occasion I struggled to access it the reception staff went and re-set the router to fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: “The Potential is there”
Reviews.Author: FAV2
Reviews.Content: Champion’s World Resort is by no means a stellar resort comparable to most of the Disney properties, Hyatt Grand Cypress, Gaylord Palms or some of the other mega resorts in Orlando. It is also not the worst hotel I have seen in the Central Florida area either. It is one of the cheapest properties I have come across (by cheapest I mean average per nightly cost for a room) in the many years I have been traveling to Orlando. But do not avoid this property because of the price, it is a true value compared to other hotels in the Central Florida area I have found priced between $20 and $30. While there we notice larges patches of dirt everywhere. Areas which probably were once home to nice green lawns and some pretty bushes and shrubs. Overnight someone places dozens of plants and bushes in the patches of dirt; this showed us that Champions World Resort is working on improving their resort instead of watching it decay away like so many other dated hotels along 192. Surprisingly to us, the hotel room was extremely roomy. We have traveled a lot to the Orlando area recently and Champions Gate World Resort was one of the largest rooms we have had yet for a standard hotel room. Even the bathroom, which sometimes seems like a jail cell in some hotels, was rather big and did not feel cramped at all. While on the topic of the bath room, one of the only complaints I had of the resort was the complexity of adjusting the knobs in the bath tub. It took a few tries before I was able to have a nice warm shower without it being extremely freezing or overly hot. The room its self was a standard hotel room complete with the chest of drawers, television, coffee maker, iron, table and two chairs. Even with these items in the room there was still lots of space allowing for lots of mobility in the hotel room. The hotel features three pools on the premises, the largest being the covered pool located next to the main building. During winter we were told this pool is a heated pool, but since it was the summer/ fall time it was somewhat chilly seeing how no sunlight ever hit the pool due to its location under the large covering. Next to the covered pool is a children’s pool. There is nothing special about these pools, no water slides, no water sprayers, they are just pool, but those looking for a bargain hotel are probably willing to sacrifice amenities such as those in order to secure a hotel room for sometimes under $25 a night. The other two pool are located in different areas of the property, one even includes a hotel tub which we did not visit on this trip. The other pools are your standard rectangular pool with plenty of lounge chairs circling the pool. The pool we visited had an area for an outdoors bar which looked like it had not been used since the Village People scored their last #1 hit back in the 1970’s which was a shame. My fiancé made a note of how even more awesome the resort would be if they had the pool bad open and served drinks for the guests. Perhaps in the future they will because it was very apparent there were lots of renovations taking place all over the property. Speaking of the property, the over grounds looked somewhat dilapidated but as we mentioned, it was obvious they were in the midst of improving the over look of the hotel with new landscaping, renovations taking place in several of the building. Give this resort some time and the end result could make for a nice, rather affordable place to stay. While Champion’s World Resort calls itself a resort, it lacked many of the amenities one would find in a Central Florida resort including a gym, tennis courts, scheduled activities, children’s areas, and an arcade. Maybe over time these resort amenities will be added but for now, Champions World Resorts lacks the above listed items to truly call itself a resort. The $3 Resort fee guest pay seems to only include use of the pool and free internet while visiting the property, which is a bargain since many other resorts in the Central Florida area charge sometimes over $20 a night for Internet and do not have that many options for their pools in the event they become over crowded at one. The Restaurant/bar area was above average compared to some mid-ranged hotel in the area. They seemed to always have drink specials and the restaurant looked somewhat like a Denny’s overlooking their covered pool area. The Lobby area was extremely nice and it was apparent that this was one of the first areas that was remodeled when it was reopened as Champions World Resort. Beware of the people in the area trying to pressure you into seeing time shares though. While they are aggressive, one no is all it took for them to leave us alone. Perhaps the biggest draw back of Champions World Resort is their location. It is approximately 7 miles from the back entrance to Disney World and close to 10 miles from I-4. The drive to and from the hotel could get old very quickly for the vacationer staying for more than one night at Champions World Resort even though it is a comfortable and affordable place to stay. If you are on a strict budget and do have a car accessible to you or do not mind traveling to the theme parks based on the bus times they provide for you (yes, they do offer complementary bus service to all the theme parks) then the distance can be overlooked seeing how there are several places to eat in the mornings and evenings within walking distance of the hotel. In conclusion, Champions World Resort is definitely a work in progress. While other out-dated Orlando area hotels charge a relatively small fee for their rooms, you usually get what you paid for (dirty rooms, noisy neighbors, rude staff) but not at Champions World Resort. If you can overlook the distance from the attractions, you will easily find one of the most affordable and comfortable thrifty hotels in the Central Florida area, just do not expect a Disney style resort when you stay at Champions World Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Should be minus 3*!!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie15
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the worst places I have ever seen. Within five minutes of opening the door to the room I knew my family and I would not be staying. The two rooms my family and I were allocated were very damp and dirty. The problem with the damp was reported to reception immediately and we were told the rooms could be sparayed with a chemical to eradicate the smell of damp and the maintenance man would be with us within a few minutes! We never did see the maintenance man or the chemical. Everything within the rooms and outside of the reception area was dirty, grubby and dingy, personally I felt quite unsafe being there after encountering a few undesirable people within the hotel grounds! The swimming pool was also absolutely filthy. How this hotel managed to achieve a 3* rating is beyond me. Fortunately, I was able to move my family out of this place within 24 hours to a fabulous hotel on International Drive. I would strongly urge you to stay as far away from this hotel as possible, pay that little bit extra and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “NOT ALI BUT MORE KEN NORTON (an effective hotel)”
Reviews.Author: joviawitness
Reviews.Content: A well spent 10 days at Champions Resort. All Staff were excellent especially front desk and maintenance. Rodrigo you're the man! We have a young child so thingsas you would expect were quite tricky but upon request, help for whatever we needed was provided. Rooms were cleaned to a suitable standard. On return from breakfast we always found our room tidied and beds already made. Karaoke nights were a BLAST!!. Swimming pool excellent form of relaxation especially after a hard days play at Disney. The hotel is geared towards visiting the Disney resorts. The location is ideal. The Shuttle Service is excellent and breakfast does the job. You get what you pay for! The money you save on hotel accommodation can be put to good use at the numerous theme parks. Only grumbles are Tennis courts in need of repair and choice of more t.v channels and perhaps a kettle. Really enjoyed our stay and would definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and need of rennovation”
Reviews.Author: PDM47
Reviews.Content: This hotel/motel was supposedly rennovated as under new management. Our room was dirty with mould in the bathroom. The air con sounded like to plane taking off so we couldn't use it. We asked for a kettle on the day we arrived (14 night stay) and there were none, and was told to come back next day. We did this every day for the 14 days - became of running joke in the end. Room was also very basic. The pools looked OK but didn't venture in them. The first night we also ate in the bar and the food was revolting and well over priced. The next morning went down early to breakfast and half the containers were empty so for what we had that ended up being very expensive too. We've been to Florida with Virgin Holidays several times and always been pleased so can't see why they have this calibre of hotel/motel in their books. Maybe Virgin should check it out for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: MsPraise
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Champions World Resort from Aug. 9-13, 2009 and honestly I was impressed for the price we paid. While there were a few things that irritated me they were minor, but the overall stay was nice and the kids truly enjoyed the 3 pools onsite. The check in process was smooth as we arrived early and was able to check in at noon versus 3pm which was a definite plus for us...so we truly thank Champions for that convenience. The few things I didn't like was the fact that you basically get harassed by folks trying to sell you timeshares in exchange for $75-$100 if you sit through a 90 minute presentation. Now in my opinion...if that was something I was in too fine, but most folks on vacation don't want people HARASSING them to sit for 90 minutes for $75-$100...we're on vacation and would like to enjoy it, so this little service they can do away with. Another thing that I didn't like was having to pay for internet $3.00/3 minutes and $0.39/cent each additional minute and if you want to print anything its $1.00/page, so using the internet for 3 minutes to print boarding passes cost me $5.02...again...something minor but something I didn't like and think they need to upgrade immediately. The staff was courteous and helpful which was a plus and really went out of their way to help make your stay enjoyable. Checkout was a breeze which was even better as we got a late start for an early flight. I would stay here again if I wanted to be budget conscious and its close to a variety of stores...everything you think you want is near or close to it.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't "terrible", but I wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: mlnclrmn
Reviews.Content: We paid only $45 per night, so I didn't expect much. The property is very old and it appeared that little, if anything, had been done in the way of updating. Carpet needed replacing, nicks in walls, etc. The bathroom door wouldn't close completely, the fan in the bathroom didn't work and the tub drain was very slow. That is pretty gross when you are taking a shower. Although it was a non-smoking room, there was a lingering hint of smoke in the draperies and air ducts, I suppose from days gone by. The Lysol I brought with me took care of most of that, if I sprayed it daily. The housekeeping staff did a good job of cleaning the room daily and the front desk staff was pleasant. The advertised WiFi didn't work in the room and there was a charge for the computers in the lobby area. Based on the price we paid, we pretty much got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “"Welcome home" is made real by your staff at the check-in desk.”
Reviews.Author: MiriamBradenton_FL
Reviews.Content: July 30, 2009 General Manager or Chief Executive Officer Champions World Resort 8660 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway Kissimmee, FL 34747 Beginning with early May of 2008, I have spent many Saturday nights at your motel. I arrive mid-afternoon and check out around 8:30 Sunday morning. The first time I stayed there, I chose it because of location (it was in an area with which I was somewhat familiar and I did not have to depart from it in order to get back on my route) and appearance. Going to the counter to inquire about a room that first time, I met Juan Carlos who was the soul of accommodation and hospitality. Since I stay there alone, I prefer a room near the front so I am not in a remote area and he always sees to that. (Now they all do.) Subsequently, in addition to Juan Carlos, I have had the pleasure of meeting and being helped by, Eurina, Rodrigo, Luis, Haley, and most recently, Jenny Vasquez (and when I have actually called ahead for a reservation, Shirley and I believe, Myra). In December I had foot surgery and when I was allowed to get the surgical site wet but not yet stand on my foot, I asked for 101, a handicapped room with a bench in the shower and was also given that room subsequently while my foot was healing. I very much appreciated that extra consideration. Many places of business have a slogan; some fit and some don’t. “Welcome home” certainly fits your place. When I walk in the door, since I am there so frequently, Juan Carlos sometimes calls across the lobby, Welcome home, Madam. He said that since I am there so often, when I walk in the door, I should just say, Juan Carlos, my key, please! Sometimes I have done so in fun. We initially choose the places where we do business on the basis of different things. Sometimes it is location; sometimes it is service; sometimes it is price. But after the initial visit or contact, whatever the place of business, it is the employees, the staff, who determine if the customer or client will return. It is the people who make the difference. I have driven extra miles to go to another branch of my bank to avoid the personnel at the branch nearer me and to go to the other one where I prefer the attitude of the personnel there. Both branches of the bank provide the same services but it is the personnel of the one which cause me to forego one and choose the other, farther away. Your facility is beautiful, wonderfully and conveniently located for me; also very important, I feel secure there; I have appreciated the rate I have enjoyed; but more than all of that, I appreciate those I have named above. They are definite assets because there (just as they were when it was Howard Johnson’s) they are the face and the Spirit of Champions World Resort and they represent it well. They are the ones we see; they are the ones who make the difference. You should be very proud of them and appreciate them greatly. Sincerely, A. Potter

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as i thought - but beware of the animals roaming freely at night”
Reviews.Author: lillith305
Reviews.Content: We booked this holiday with Virgin and knew not to expect 5 star accomodation, however was rather reluctant after reading horror stories. On arrival the receptionist requested a credit card deposit - we declined becasue we had prepaid holiday and would not use in room telephone. the receptionist accepted this. Our room overlooked the covered swiming pool and had a fridge which was excellent. Rooms cleaned everyday and towels changed daily. Excellent - yes but the rooms are not cleaned properly and lots of dirt and grime arround the walls and floor covering, which made us feel really unclean. The pools are excellent but the pool areas, grounds and stairwells should be cleaned as the hotel grounds really are filthy. One note of caution - a rancoon (yes that is what the other guest told us was the name of this strange creature with a pointed nose) was scavaging around usually after 11pm - I was scared as not used to such animal in the UK, a cat was also walking around the grounds and we were not sure if this was the hotel pet or stray - so quite frighting. The guest who had pets ensured their animals where carefully attended to. In summary, the hotel is an ideal location and parking is free, we only spend 1 day in the hotel and was quite bored but my daughter loved the covered swinming pool. It is very good value and I think it would be cheaper to book indpendant from a travel company. Also, witht he money saved one good do more shopping and also have a holiday somewhere else. We would return to this hotel but only if 1. we were guaranteed a room overlooking the covered swiming pool and on the top floor ( crawlies are reported to occupy the ground floor rooms). 2. The timeshare touts do not pester us - they really are the pits - of course we did not fall for their promises. 3. The issue with the animals is dealt with becasue a child could approach one and I dread to think of the consquences.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY WHEN ON A WONDERFUL VACTION!!!”
Reviews.Author: misskat9806
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The staff is outgoing and VERY attended. They have AMAZING pools with karioke nights on weekends. They have a playground for younger children. The rooms are big and SUPER nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: RSR67
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading some horror stories about the Champions World Resort here in Trip Advisor i had to say something, I've been staying at this resort since they were Howard Johnson and my experience has been a lot different. They have remodeled most of the rooms and the pools and amenities are great. They are still working on the hotel so you can expect some areas to be under construction but it isn't something that will ruin your vacation. The price is always exellent and they have always solve any complaint i had. So if you are looking for a great place to stay at a low price this is it. It is close to Disney and other major atractions and restaurants. I will surely stay again and recomend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sherri76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family the kids loved the heated pool and arcade room right by the pool. Realy helpful staff will stay here again when I come back to Orlando, Fl

Reviews.Title: “Looks are totally decieving”
Reviews.Author: mamigwen
Reviews.Content: Not happy at all. Totally not what was expecting. billing issues

HotelInfo.Name: Champions World Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 8660 W Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy, (A.K.A West US-192), Kissimmee, FL 34747
